q85: Jim Crow is a problem that most of my fellows think should come to an end. It my take years, but after all we realized that it just ain't happened over night for it to stop. I felt that this is one point should be handled like a baby more less nursed. It is so much that we want to associate with the "white women" but we feel like this, some of us has gone through 1st hell while in the army. We have toiled and sweated from the brow as well as other races and I fill [insertion]feel[/insertion] that we should a freedom of speech (more than has in the southern laws) a freedom of pleasure; by that I meant ride along where on buses & streetcars a Freedom of social activities. I feel that if some of these things haven't been looks into by  time peace is made when all the soldiers get back. That there will be another Civil war. Voting is one thing that every man should have the privilege of. We toiled and sweat like the other races have and we believe that things will be changed and (have) to be changed for we feel that we (negro) soldiers are fighting for democracy.
For a man my age who has never had any army training before, life is hard. That's one reason I say men should be drafted for a years service after the war.

I hope the conditions after the war, in the United States are changed, there are many things I could say, but particular the racial problem. I feel that the American Negro soldier, the 10% of the Army, the 14% of the front lines, will find the Mr. Charlies of America will still have the back doors, and back streets open for him, the equality and democracy he fought for is still not ready to share with him his rightful place in society. In all walks of life, the road to success is the longest for the dark skin boy, and always there is the inferiority example between races. I'd like to see all America stand in one solemn oath and say "Wee, the inhabitants of this land, are all true Americans." There is nothing Sen. [Senator] Bilbo and his kind can do to change this way of life.

I have been in the army for about a year and when induct [inducted] didn't feel like going but though [thought] that it was better to make to [the] best of it. While in school I was making good marks and was looking forward to going to college. With what I had learned in school on radio and electrical motors I thought that I would be put in the signal corp but landed in a bakery company  This maybe what I will do after the war but not what I like at all. Ever since I was a little boy of 9 yrs I have played around with some electrical part; this was mostly cause by of friend of my [mine] that live next door who was studying electricity. After the war is over I hope that all the soldiers will get the same break no matter what his family tree is or his and no matter what color his God loving skin happens to be. I thank you.
I think the Race problem will be worse after th war, so many whites feel like the Negro is getting too good opportunitys [opportunities] now and will try to stop it

Personally at my age I would rather be out of the Army altho I have learned many things  I never thought of before. Have did things and work that I never thought I could do and if I were younger and no one but myself then I'd stay int he Army until they put me out with a pension.   -21-  RESTRICTED

I feel that in the Army we were trained to serve in branches that we had no commercial experience and within that space of Army career we were taught and we learned quite a bit to that fact in some cases there should be considered if possible that man be given the chance to exercise his ability to the fact that he is quite up on that particular study.

Conditions after the war will be in  boom  for at least two or three years. As it was in the last. After then we will be up against it again. Struggling for a living. There are all types of bill being made up now to  this, but probably I don't think it can. We  believe  that in this country every one  does  have  intentions  of  doing  what they can for others, but they soon forget them and look out for themselves  if only this could be avoided and we all stick and see it through we may come through this  crisis  much easier and with out [without] such poverty and struggle.

After serving int he U.S. Army for a year and  months I should say I have   I wouldn't think the army as Jim Crow as some of the southern states. Unfortune I did. Rather than return to the same place, I'll rather spend the remainder of my life in what ever     The government should be able to give it  men a better way of living the should give him a better job and a better nation
I like to say that it will be great when the war is over. ( ) And I can get back home to   and that I am proud of this

only one question. after the war and the reconstruction period begin what about the colored soldiers who have progressed them selfes since they have been in the army can they obtain jobs to suit their ability or will they go back to the same trend they had before the war as janitors. and what about all the women? Will they give up the jobs - to the returning soldiers as they should or will they be encouraged to continue working in jobs suited for men.

Unless legislation is enacted and enforced insuring my race (negro) the opportunity to work and live as free americans, which has never been done, all the things that we have fought and died for will amount to nothing. As I see it, unless my people are given radically different treatment in the future, the U.S. faces a long term of riots, lynchings and a possible civil war. We aren't getting fair treatment in the Armed Forces or at home. Yet we are told we should be proud of our country. Make us Free and let us share it. Please give us who were born here, the same chance you give those who immigrate here and become naturalized citizens.
nothing to say but I would like to go home

After being in the army for 1 month I have found that many Negro men aren't placed in the branches which they desire. Men with  go ---l  experance [experience] in one brance [branch] is generally places [placed] in one where he is more or less useless, or it is one brance [branch] where he has no intentions to get in. I had studyed [studied] some medicine and was placed in a baking company and have found some bakers in the medical corp. I think If the government would give the men more consideration the army would help a great deal in preparing a man for his lifes work and If I was sent to the medic in the beginning I would have gained more rather than less some of that which I had learned.
I think conditions in the United States should be better after the war is over if a lots of things should be changed after the war and I guess this war will be like the other one was for my race.

I have heard that the government is willing to send to school that qualify & am interested in taking up some trade after the war. I don't think I would care to continue the same type of work I am doing now.

I believe that the men should be released from the Armed forces immediately after the war. Many men have spent the best years of their life in the Army I think they should be given every chance to lead a successful life upon being released. most of us Service men are not looking for handouts, merely the opportunity to suport our self and family and maintain a decent standard of life. We are looking to the various Govt Agency for the War Veteran to give us a start along the road to our return to civilian life not to maintain us.

I don't feel that it is right for me to send money to some one without the will  to?  My wife do not live with me and do not save my money and that worry me very much for no one to see about it. she live with someone else and should get support from them. I wish some one would see about this matter. As being in the army I can't get a leave when I want to so naturally I can't do any thing about it For that reason my moral is very very low.

Conditions Which now exist in the United States must definitely change in order to keep the Country from dissolusion [dissolution], and heart fealt [heartfelt] injustice that lingers in the borders of a Country who stands for equality. A world, a nation, a man, can never be content seeing injustice, discrimination sweep over his own portals, and with a clear conscience say his evironment [environment] has been liberated. That he can liberate another people while in our own gates lie a more destructive force. When let ourselves overlook the one thing that brings about unrest. The cause is lost. Equality is no more than a mere addition to the language. To cover shortcomings of those who might presevent wrongs. The Time is now present when all men feel or sense the better way to build is solely upon Equality, politically. Industrially and morally.

I think that some of the Negro soldiers who are place in the South are getting a rotten deal from the way the whites are treating them.  After the war I hope that racial condition will be better and every man, woman and child be treated equal, and given the same chance as the next fellow, and I hope that will so in the  as well as the  .

The army is no good for me and no other man like me and you know why, because I am colored. But some day you won't be topes and you will be sorry and I do mean sorry for doing the colored the way you do.
Mostly Southern Discrimination is going to start a revolution between Colored and Whites if not stopped in time. Senator Bilbo should be hung

The thing that I consider most importance after the war is the relation of the negro and white man. For this country to continuy [continue] and the world to remain at peace we as American disregard this color line that we have and expecially in the South for the Negro has here over there fighting along side at the white man and know he believes that has a country that he is going to maybe help protect it and thus he is also to protest from the inside too. The (Negro) dose want to social with the white man all that want is and equal chance to make his living and to help elect who he thinks is best fit to lead him. This isn't very much to ask for so let give it to him and live peacefully ever after.

I think that the goal we are fighting for should be in???: after a pattern that Russia has found in her way of thinking (A) Capital Punishment for all offenders of racial discrimination if necessary. The soldiers are fighting now against a vicious enemy for that reason today. (2) Thinking that one race has the right to be better than another there will always be conflict. This thing can be eased if steps are taken. There is still evidence of certain branches of the Army refusing persons if other races a chance to give them service (Nurses) Lately a few have been taken but the percentage is still very small.

It should be a Law to stop the white people for taken the colored people land and trying to run over them. we all are trying to fight for the same thing to be free and live. the way it going on now we don't see no changes - and it will be the same after.  So the black man is not Free at Mississippi. that is he is going to be done after war?
No I dont have any thing I want to say about the army or the United States

I think conditions in the United States will be different after the war. There will be better race relations. Better jobs. More opportunities more and higher paid jobs. Access to nice homes. Better living conditions. More housing. More medical attention. I think the country will go forward with higher strides and be more United [delete]than[/delete] than before the war.

I should like to speak on this damn discrimination, pardon expression. I do hope it shall cease after the War and greatly improve. I think it know doubt will do the better. We won't stand for it, we won't be as lenient. We'll take drastic measures. I feel the most sensible way to clear this, is through organizations like NAACP etc. But there will be a lot of ill-tempered, important people, like all humans, but we all react to things differently and in accordance with these American reactions shall be the basis of these likely  which will occur. For strikes just one thing after another. Right now I could take you to St. Louis and show you a white and colored soldier who just shed blood together overseas and the colored fellow don't by a that dog down town. Things like this which may seem insignificant to you, mean a hell of a lot to us. We want equal rights in other words we want democracy and what it stands for.

I personally have many things against the Army. My greatest kick against the Army is in its qualification of the men with which it is compared. Knowing only of the situation as it exists in and around my company I can easily say that there has been a great mistake in the classification of the men. It is true that the army is made up of men from all over the country and men of all trades, but instead of the army classify these men according to their ability they do it just the opposite. I guess the army has its own methods for these procedures, but the army alone can make such a mess of it. It is true that the men in this army are doing a magnificent job but a better job could be done if only there were done in a more military manner than trying to fight a war with paper. I could go on forever talking about this one subject one man opinion out of thirteen million matters little.

I hope for  that the negotiations will be given a better chance after the war to make a man out of himself and not what people think he is. Now to talk about the army. The negros are fighting the war justas the white man is but he is  treated like  . You may not think so but there are  of differences shown between the colored solder and the white. I know because I am a negro soldier. I only pray that after the war the negros will be let along so that he may  for  give his family the same treatment as the white man gives his. White and colored are both men but to me we  more like cats & dogs.

As for me, I am not for war but if we are got to be drafted into the services we as a colored Race Should be allowed every opportunity of any other race.  some places we are but so few. I feel that certain percentage of us can think and do the right as well as anyone else.  I don't feel that we as a race of people should be branded by such men as Bilbo, Garner, Cotton Ed. Smith, and Byrd of Virginia. The race who dominate have bad one in it as well as we have to check us for facts. We have done more good thing for this country than any other Race. And we were brought here. We did not ask to come here. And all we ask for is that what you have promise us. that is one big surprise. I had when I was drafted. to find we are segregated in the army.

I feel that the years I used in  stocking  up for a profession has been toottly wasted in the army.  When and if I get out, soon I hope. The mentall torture I have went thru will have as   by all  training in civilian life.  As for the U.S.A. is concerned I can't say its learned the true meaning of democracie [democracy] and freedom and equall [equal] rights. Not that I'm prejudice in the least bit, I said  to speak for my kind. That and that alone is what has made me decide to leave your country. I can't say it's my country for I am here against my will although I entered partly at the request of my family and partly because I thought I'd have a chance of advancement. If I am any better of after the war it will be  entirely  through my own efforts and if not I will have what I had when I entered this country plus a wife, though I do not feel obligated to the country in the least and as to its standing after the war its of little concern to me.

I say that conditions will be better after the war because I feel that they must be. I intend to do my part in making them so, and I do not mean that "personally my conditions have been more unfavorable than those of my fellowman. But I do expect our leaders in civilian life to have already made plans for the post war life and to have brought enough force to bear to effect those desired plans.

The condition is the United State could be much better such as the food it could be better in lots of Camps such as Camp Ellis. They have nothing for the men to get excise [exercise] with in lots of the Camps here in the States.

I wish that after the war these jobs will be so that everyone can be happily I would like for the discrimination of race & color to be cut out. We serve I fought side by side, why not live like that after the war. The country will never be better if that keeps up. I think that is the things that will have to be change after the war.

All soldiers should be given an opportunity to do the things he wants to do, such as the kind of work he want to do, to live where he want to live and have the things he want to so long as they meet with the laws of the United States.
I would to be forthere enlighten on the subject of government help after the war to Enlisted men.

The conditions that prevail at Camp Ellis [illinois] are abominable. I realize that soldiers who are overseas find conditions much worse and sympathize but I contend, that here in the USA it is a shame that soldiers are treated as if they were inhuman. In communication, I might add that the transportation system is also SNAFU [Situation Normal - All Fucked Up] . And one of the main gripes of the EM [enlisted men] is camp Ellis. As I see it, transportation is under the same heading  as main  ,a distinct morale builder. If a soldier has to spend one third of his pass time waiting at a bus or train station he is going to resent it. Wouldn't you?

After the war things should be better, there isn't any reason why it shouldn't. and if it isn't the GI soldier is going to feel awful bad because this thing he goes through is something to crow about, at least it is here. This branch of service and this God forsaken outpost is a substitute for hell.

Well their one - one thing I would like to know why havent I got the what all of the men in my company think I should have gotten. because I worked very hard for these things but everything I did it so I    about it? ( ) If every one think these things I'm wondiering why my Co. [company] did feel the same way? I really would like to know this? If you please? at one time I felt good about going over seas but after I didn't get what I worked for I dont feel justified in my going with the company. I feel as I'm not needed. I just wonder if you all will feel this way, also I have been Cpl. [corporal] for 15 months now?
I would think if any man isn't fit to serve in the army he should be in any service at all.

q85: I say that after the war the Negroes should be given the same  opportunity  as the whites, because they both fought for their rights  , therefore it should be.  I also say that the duration plus should not be served by those  accross   nor those in Camps, should be sent over in no-mans land to [underline] police [/underline] up. Let the enemy prisoners pay the price of war by at least doing that much and every one else come home where we belong. USA.  The ever present 4 F's should be allowed to do what is necessary in the U.S. Camps  before even the war ends.  The world is in a  terrible   tension  - some thing must be done to relieve it immediately. Send the boys home as quick as possible. [underline] Note [/underline] . I realize that the Army has priority over where to place individual soldiers. Here a fellow spends 500.00  every night (4)) hrs. hard concentrated study in Embalming + its related subjects, Pathology, Anatomy, Biology, etc. Then a fellow with no knowledge of it at all, gets in the Medical Det -  As large as the U.S. Army is, those qualifies specialists should be assigned to a unit which their knowledge deals with if not I know there is something else left better than a service company. They are for these unskilled people, labor  . OF course they are respectable jobs. I think that has affected the morale of many + many a good soldier.  Personally I haven't gotten anything out of it that will benefit me any too much.  If a person cannot be assigned to a unit which he  qualifies for  ten let him go home + get into  or into essential work  Seemingly in closing the Army has defeated in many cases its ultimate aim, high morale to men [underline] under any  . [/underline]  [underline] The large vast  + enormous surplus men the army has control of, not doing a doggone thing but laying on their  spot. 1 year 2 years or more. Is that helping win war quicker. Using the Governments money when it could be spent for wounded, Old Age, Hospitals, instead of  taking samples]

After the war I feel that all men should be given an equal opportunity for development regardless of race, creed, or color. I also feel that the Government should see to it as nearly as possible that all able bodied ex-servicemen and others as well are given a fair chance to survive.

Yes again I  quoted  men in the service should be paid more.  When relisted from service meaning to get an good start for himself.  And by all a fair an honest good chance if he or her has a litter  deferet  .  Im sure it will make him fell proud to say in which that he had helped his country and well as for him self.  To see what he was fighting or.  Lets all be fair.  Life will be worth living [underline] for [/underline]

The army like every other branch of the Armed Forces gives very few Negroes a chance to do what he wanted to do. The army takes a negro and puts him right in the WM or any other service that does slave work. I know a lot of capable young men who hate the army because some dumb Non-Com officer is over them. I would work in a defence for nothing if I could get out of the Army. My moral has been way down ever since I've been in. There nothing in here that interests me. I wish I could die get killed or get discharged so I could forget about the time I've put in.

I feel that Armed Maintenance after the war should be large enough to meet any emergency.  As to conditions after the war, I feel that the consideration should be given to all U.S. citizens regardless to creed or color, and every effort exercised to formulate a medium that will mean mutual understanding and justice to all.

After the war I think [insertion] the [/insertion] Army should look out for Ex-servace [ex-service] men fully. They should have first chance to all  and any jobs they prefer. And to those who are disabled cripple blind and etc. should be treated with the best of care no prejective what ever. What I mean just don't send them so much a month, not knowing their conditions. But treat them as they were treate while in service. Lookout for them to the fullest estent. And too the guys who are able to work I think they should be able to borry [borrow] a certain amount of money from the Government to get started. I'll say about two or threr [three] thousands dollors [dollars] ($3,000) with about twenty or twenty five years to pay. With an intrest [interest] of three or four cent on a dollor [dollar]

I do hope that this country will always have a standard army. Although speaking generally my self, I hope that the condition of our country will be a better place to live in. We have worked hard for what is about to happen and that is ever lasting peace. I do hope we will maintain that peace. I also hope that the anti-lynching bill be passed and forced. The name of Senate Bilbow be erased forever, because as I see it this country will always have that same prejudice with some like him to stir the hate up. When some of the thing is almost forgotten. I think we should have fair play, we have shedded blood on the beaches as other races so give us racial equality.
I hope to live under better laws after the war than I did before the war. I am hoping that every man will have his rights to the ??? of life.

There are a great many things I want to say but time nor space permits me to say it here. In the first place Negroes are tired of shedding blood for the so called Democracy that he does not receive. Most of us feel that we have little or nothing to fight for. All of this will have to change. I do not feel that I should go to Germany to fight Nazis. When we have a lot of them just across the old Mason Dixon line. There are countless cases of the mistreatment of the negro in southern army camps and they are ignored by the army. The northern colored soldier would rather go overseas than to train in one in the south. And this will be forgotten after the war. I would also like to see the Government to be a better stand on the rights of the negro now and after the war. If this is not done then we will have to take one ourselves. You see I am a negro Soldier.

Well I am not getting my   love   life  in the arm. Why I don't now and another I hope you all go down south and  strate  [straighten out] the people down their the White people. Because they don't treat our colored people right. So please do that and the German  prisoners  getting  treated  better than us colored  present  and that all. But  if  some  but I hope you all will  strate  [straighten] this out.

I think every man regardless to race, creed or color should be given the same chance in every respect as we are all in the same country in the same army for the same cause, Jobs should be ex-service men first, if they can do the job equally as well as the ones that have not served in the army, We should believe in the Preamble of the Constitution of the U.S. and what it stands for. We should have all the most cooperation of every man on this country, And above all take in the consideration of the Bible and love every man as brother.
