I can take anything that is handed to me now but I will need plenty of help in he future. I wonder if I will be able to get it?
I dont think that there should be any discrimination in the army as what is because for all in here fighting for same thing Y when you get on the battle field those bullets are not discriminated.

The army isn't run as it should be but influence by various sectional reactionary of countries. People of government positions try to mix politics with military security. In power as far as material, man power and the like the United States army is very strong but otherwise very, very weak and I mean in what we are fighting for. The axis soldier knows what he is fighting for but can you find many American soldiers who can truly say the are fighting for any special purpose? The army doesn't emphasis unity??? to make a good fighting team but are influence to carry out prejudices practise by ignorant leaders in politics scatter throughout the country. I am hoping that after the war people will be brought closer together in human relationships and don't have to wait until the next war to allow various groups in the country to maintain jobs they are qualify to do in peace time, but have to wait for war to show their worth.

The Army is O.K but no good for the minority group. When this veil of prejudice is lifted from their ???? the continent  and all races will be given an equal chance to learn to do I know then and only then that we as a nation will be in position to suggest to other nations. Then and only then will I be perfectly willing to be a volunteer in the United States Army. [underline] Need I say more! [/Underline]

I first hope I will not have to wait 2 or 3 years for a job after  its  war.  because  I will have a wife and family to support and I do want to have a happy home. And I believe a good job would do the trick.

The Army isn't a fair organization for the members of one race haven't been given a square deal. We have some very intelligent Negroes in the Army today but we aren't given a chance to better jobs & etc. We are Jim Crowed & everything else thats goes with it. Are [our] boys are fighting & dying for what we don't have anything at all to fight for, for after the war is over Jim Crow will still go an [and] the white soldier will get the best as usual & we will get the left-overs. On my part the Army can go to hell.
Conditions after the war should be better than before. War supposed to change things and if it for the worst the U.S. would be on the downward move instead of better those conditions.

This is what I thinks of things. every man in the arm forces is a  and they sould get equal Right if they have been  that sould have  been  Done  We are colored race true but we  get our Equal Right We are all  to get . Why can't we  if we pull together. We could get along  . We know every thing go s something you on  but we have to take it  right I am saying this because I have been treated the same way so  think it over for a  chance and get together. We are all fighting for the same thing for Right.

What I'd like to know is why only a few of our Negro Soldiers are actually fighting on all war fronts. After all the Negro of today is completely different from the Negro of yesterday. Many black men are giving their lives in this war.This is a white man's war, not a Negro's. Though I was born in this Country, why should I give my life away for something by which the white Race as a whole may profit by.To hell with the five freedoms [Four Freedoms]. They're only the figure head for the White Man's sovereignty, over there in fox holes, they're equal. Like two brothers. But over here, the black man wouldn't by any means by accepted into Society. Freedom is won only on the battlefield.So the negro must by all means rise. Come forward and express himself to White Society. Viva Viva the Negro Race.

Fist let me say as far as the war is concerned I don't see why I am fighting for something but don't know what it is. People say things are going to be better for the Negro. Well I don't see ho. We are treated like some disease and some places won't even give you a job. The army is alright for some people but as for me. I've been sorry ever since the first day I got into an Army uniform. And as far the conditions, we don't stand a ghost of a chance with any of the other groups of people. They tell you that you are going to be one thing and when you get in the Army it's another. You are told you will be put in a place suitable for your talent, but in the long run you wind up just where they want you to be. Yes I said before you can have this war and fight it by yourself but as for me give me freedom. The sooner the better.

I don't think the army did everything it could concerning racial relations. Men coming out of the army with the same ideas they went in with, is bound to cause serious differences. I believe there has been orders or regulations comparing the questions out that's all. They haven't been carried out. Then again the actual part that has been played and is being played by all Americans in combat at present is being kept from the American people. I know of no other land but America, this land I love I will do my utmost to help racism and it True it is, the home of the brave.

As one of the minority group as negro, I would like to see the negroes get a better chance in the so called democracy.. It is pretty hard to take things from people who think they are really better than others. Yet we all have to die so you see no one is really better than the others. The white man is whipping the germans and Japs for the unpleasant treatment they are dishing out to the other nations and the white man is doing the same thing to the negroes. As a soldier I don't feel I have much to fight for when it comes to going over seas.
I think the army does teach a man to work with a large group. The army has taught many young men new occupations.

Yes me and a many men like me have been told that it will be better after the war, but the way things have been Acting even in the Army camps of North & South You could expect there to fear or believe none other than the worst. This is suppose to be a war of Democracy but we as a race don't even know what the worst is from the treatment we are getting and has been getting and are suppose to be soldier of the same Army and as a hold [whole] we are all suppose to be Citizens of the United States. Now please tell me just what are we fighting for because we don't know The Prejudice is too great [?]
I would like to no [know] why in the camp in the South the officers call you any thing [anything] a [and] you are treated like  . I was taught that they were to call you Soldier.

The Constitution of the United States stipulated a paragraph that all men are created equal no matter in what [underline] race, creed, or color [/underline] . Well I ask myself sometimes should I really believe this. I'm sure it is written down because I have read it many a time, but by heaven above I can't seem to believe in it. The reason I wrote that statement because I am a member of the minority group. In whatever we do (  only  about the minority group) we have to excel to stand up with the other group and still we in some way or the other  oppressed  do to the fact that we are discriminated, get all kind of injustice and do not in enjoy the  liberty as others. I do hope that soon, very very soon, this  paragraph will be carried out in every extent.

Yes, the conditions of the way we are divided where we work. The sargent in charge, pays us less than what we are supposed to get. We have a major who hates colored. So we get a raw deal all the time. We can't complain because we are threaten with overseas duty, also of the guard house, passes taken away and other things.Also, they put people over us who were borned and raised in the south. Who hate you because you are in the same camp as them. Why don't stop and think that when our boys are across the pond. Bullets stop and look at you to see what color you are. They let prisoners of war eat any place they want. In nice places, like clubs, large hotels, cafes. But if we want something to eat we either go to the back door or go to the greasy spoon, or some other fifth rate place.

The first point I want to bring out is this [insertion] ; [/insertion] we are fighting a war for the preservation of Democracy. How in the world can we fight for something we can't have at home. The army should be a shining example of democracy but sad our present Army is today it is everything but that. In my discharge I just hope and wish that this question of Race could be solved giving the Negro the rights of an American. Make him proud to say that he is an American citizen and member of the  that not only preaches democracy but also practices it.

Personally after the war I think it is going to be very conjested [congested] - For those soldiers who since being in the army have lost contact with their families - wounded or injured beyond the ability to care for themselves & wish to remain in the & be cared for rather than going to some relative - I am sure that they will be given some good opportunity.

I think on the whole, the Army has been pretty fair with the negro, but there are still some places where they are discriminated against. No Nation can fully win a war unless it is fully united. Conditions in some parts of the U.S. has been favorable for the negro, but in some this is not so.  The Negro is doing his part in helping to bring peace to the world. Some have given, some still are giving their lives on foreign soil and even within the U.S. I think that after the war Negroes should be treated like they are now and better each man serving where he is best fitted, regardless of his Color.
From the looks of things up till now it is going to look bad for soldiers an civilian. All I ask is give the soldiers a chance.

for one thing I don't like the way the Mess Sgt [Sergeant] and some of the Cook treat the boys. And the way our Command Official treat some of the boys. And the first sgt [sergeant] I hope they will sent [send] him over sea [overseas] . And I would like to be over there to drill him[.] Well that all I have to say except I wish they would get something to eat in the mess hall beside [besides] so many egg [eggs] .

My ancestors fought for freedom, and I am now fighting for the same, but a place called the Mason Dixon line, is "lynching" the minority groups of races, which makes me feel as if it is no better to life under "nazi" dictatorship as it is to live under this present type of freedom of speech, freedom of rights, freedom of religion such a great government to live under.

As one man opinion, I think it will be a civil war in this country. Why? The soldiers who make it back will expect one thing and got another. Some will be push around while other live on easy street. I think also that their will be nothing killing just as it was in 1929

I think the whole thing is a lot of crap.  If one should think that the condition is going to be better and he would come in the Army I am more than sure he would change his mind. Thing have change on the outside because you are have to. In the Army, the same junk is still going on.  [underlined] See question [underlined] 30a

My race is treated bad in certain section of the country. I think they would be treated the same as the white soldier. We are fighting the same thing and why should we be jim crow in certain section of the country. I alway think what is the negro soldier fighting. I hope when the war is over, we will git the same break as the white soldier. I hope the southern states will come to life that the colored soldier has the same break as white soldier when this war is over. There has been so many slurs about the Southern camps that it make a colored soldier mad. If they don't come to life there is  soon  to be a civil war in the South.

It is contrary to proper reasoning to believe men are expected to be enthusiastic about recovering lost privileges for Europeans, when the same things are denied them in their own country because they belong to a minority group. The Army, lost most of the other agencies of a supposedly democratic government, is extremely blind to the discriminations and indignities practiced within itself. It takes money and men, throws both into an orientation program to tell us why we fight for all the virtues of democracy, then almost makes us want to fight among ourselves because it refuses to practice what it preaches. Any unit that has the access to so many young minds, and doesn't try to impress them, by actual practice, the good of democracy, is failing in its duty to the country.

As in regards to conditions after the war I don't think I have gained anything in the army to insure me of much in the future. I have seen prejuice and discriminations in the army, that I can hardly be proud I am a soldier.

Well after to the war I think the government should give wounded soldiers and those served across the sea take care of them after the war. The government also should get all men job and also send all school men who were in School back to school pay for them to finish their education because if the war had not been they would have finish school. After the War all men should treat justice and allow enjoy of living in a Democracy peace and happiness.

As far as the army is concerned itself its ok but the individual who operate makes it very miserable for certain people. Which makes it hard to endure the hard shifts that come before the individual. Therefor I want no part of the Army unless I had the same opportunities as the other to learn certain skill jobs that I would like to learn. To educate myself to better my own condition + the race as a whole.

The thing that bothers me most is the racial prejudice in this country. Until that is abolished I don't think there will be much peace here. There can be no question about the unfairness of it all. The whole country has had to undergo changes in carrying on the war. Why is it that a few states can't make the necessary necessary changes necessary to give an enduring peace within the country? The question doesn't need discussuins, but action on the part of those people in authority. How can a man be asked to go out and fight for something (democracy + freedom) he has never enjoyed and if such conditions are allowed to continue, will never have. I think it is an imperative that the race prejudice be dealt with as it is necessary to stop the Master race in Europe and  . Or do we have a master race here in the seat of democracy.

All I can say the Army needs to learn how to deal with its men. Politics in the army still prevails. Equality has yet to be achieved which is the essential part of a good army. Play fair with the soldiers of the VS and you will have good supporting citizen always. Most of the soldiers have not been treated fair. It is useless to even ask a soldier how he feels about his treatment in the army. Yes it is true a few have had a long time in the army but most of us has caught. Well not much credit for an army like that. Where is that democracy we soldiers have been hearing about. I hope we will find it after this war. We have not seen if some one have been in the army. I would like to say more but I may appear as being nondis?? to a certain bunch of army politicians. Never the less lets get together and give the soldiers a better break after the war. Don't let it be 20 years later.

I think after we are out of this war the conditions should be different from the last one. We soldiers have wife and children to depend upon us(?). And we should have some means to support them until we are able to locate a job that will see us through.

The first is base [based] entirely upon the liberty & justice that my race which I am proud of is given & the rights which we have been promised after having sworn to fight for.  Will there still be scorn, hate & jim crowaism [crowism] toward us? After sheading [shedding] blood for "peace on earth & Good will toward men"

There are quite a few things I don't think is quite right in the U.S. Such as what we are fighting for. They say that we are fighting for democracy, so that all men may be free and treated equally. Well I think that they should start right at home in practicing what they preach. Be kind to your fellow men. They say and look at how they treat the negro in the U.S. Before the war Germans and Japs could go any where they care to go but not the negro, no! Then look what happened. They all turned against this country. In Chil. the whites strike because the negros get better jobs, I call that just plain silly and only jackasses act like that I respect a jackass more than I do those kind of people.
All men should have equal rights after the war regardless of race or color. We also have shed blood for our country?

Yes sir for one thing I been in the Army all most 2 years and just a Pfc and I have two children and look like they  could get me an army rank as sergeant or corporal something and I dont like some the  .
I would like to be discarged [discharged] as soon as the war is over then I could enjoy some of the life of my young days
If I have no flag then I have no country. But we have to fight all even the world. And we are treated worth than anyone. some day our change is coming and you shall pay for all you have done.

When I came in the army I felt that I really had something to fight for now it's a different story. Why? Because instead of getting these ??? justice ideas of the people minds. They are getting worse. I had the pleasure of being stationed at Bigg Fld. Tex. There we weren't allowed to buy anything from the main AX. They had a small place in the back corner of the theatre for me to sit, not only that we had ride in the back of the bus. We had no recreation. It would hurt so much if those kind of things in the army were coming from the little man but they're coming the big  Why do they break up all good colored outfits. Are they afraid that they get too much glory. Well what ever it is I say it's rather stupid. take it from me you'll never win a war with things like these going on. One who has gone through hell in the army and for what I don't know.

I don't have much to say, but what little I do have to say is going to help this country alot [a lot] . I should like to see the negro that has been to fight for this country get the same treatment as any other person. I have been in the South and saw places where a prisoner of this country[,] which [who] has help[ed] to destroy us [our country] , go into places where the negro  slave  could not. I hope that things will be much better after the war, but as yet[,] I do not see any changes.

I think the Army made a big mistake when drafting young boys as I am not merely saying this because I am young myself but because younger boys have a right to have wives nice homes and to enjoy life. I think between the ages of 20 - to 30 should have been selected.

The army shouldn't connect so much politics with its policy and try to give the men that is qualified for a position. The position it should try to place the right commander here. We can't be is best qualifies to command if he's not qualified to operate in his present capacity give him a more subordinate position. The United States should give more attention to its own domestic condition and problems and do something about the citizen of the US should be educated in the principles they are trying to preach especially democracy.

The army should discard discrimination and there would be a lot of money saved and more time to fight this war. Such as sending men to certain camps for training and they are turn down because of their racea nd then the army will send them some other place. (time lose money lose) ( ) The army should give the soldiers of my race which is colored a better chance to serve the country.
I think the negros should have complete freedom after the war. Something that they never, in the past, have enjoyed. Many negro boys are dying, giving thier [their] life for this freedom.

Do you think the colored people and their soldiers that fought for this country will get a better brake in this country. I mean a fair and square deal as the others which in the U.S.A. We see how it is now since I myself has been in the Army and have travel throughout the states.
I think discrimination between the machinery group will remain a major problem

I do think that I could have done more for the war effort out in civilian life that I have being a soldier. Because when a man reaches the age of 30 or above if he is not physically fit you can not build him. Therefore if I had continued on the job as I was they probably could have drafted some one that would have been a little more useful and we both would have been doing out bit.
There is too much Jim Crow in and out of the Army and in my idea it will be quite a problem after the War.

The Army as a whole is a pretty fair organization. But they have their faults as well as the good part of it. I've enjoyed being in the Army for the experience but I would appreciate civilian life much better now. The reason for saying this is because of my physical condition. I was injured in April 1943 in my stomach and I have never gotten over it. Also I've had a cold since March 1943 and they claim its [it's] nothing can be done about. Once since I've been in this squadron a Doctor offered to put me in Guard house if I came on sick call anymore. I was told that when are sick to always report to sick call. So there I was sick and not able to recieve [receive] medical attention from the Army. What to do but dig in my pocket and pay a civilian doctor to try to cure me when the Army should be doing that. Now [not] only that but several other instances I don't care to mention. They are always speaking of Democracy the Negro knows of Democracy.  because it is sent [isn't] practical although we are in the Army we have to face prejudice & discrimination which is not democratic. If we should get a break it is now. If you make ratings get a few medals or honor the White soldier looks at you as if to say What the hell he's doing with that he's not as good as I am. That's damd [damned] pill to face while fighting for your country don't you think?

Only thing I wish for fair employment and good salary after the war. Only thing I wish that it will not be no segregation amost the color and white on difference job we go into as a whole I think that each and everyone should have equal right toward fair employment. Each race should have as much right for a job after the war is over.

I would like to say the colored boys and girls has caught hell in the Army. Due to certain rights the Army gives and privilages the country suppose to offer. About the war, I think if negroes are to be bettered so to receive better treatment. Now is the time while the war is on, not after. The war has cause more race hatred than enemies with other countries. To my idea this war has [insertion] not [/insertion] benefitted the negro any in some ways. Due to the conditions in the country are poor. Speaking of freedom the negro doesn't have any freedom speaking of democracy the negro doesn't  hany  any democracy. He don't know what those two things are or mean by the way he is treated in this country. If discrimination was abolish America would be a haven for the negro to live in.
Around this part of the country things probly be OK. But in the Southern states a war right there is all will help. For if we get anything we'll hope to fight for it.

There are so many things I could say. But what I consider the most important is: In a organization such as the United States Army where democratic ideals should be the strongest factor imaginable, we find some of the most corrupted and Facists ideals. These ideals are only in connection with the minority groups. Under such existing conditions who wants to fight against something thats happing [happening] on foreign lands when they need to Start fighting here in their own back yard. And I might add: The Army or no one else has ever done a damn thing about it.
I am over age and I can not find out why I am not able to get out as other men that over age.

As the situation stands every one's goal is to make this a perfect democracy. Democracy is a Government for the people, by the people and of the people as I see it is for some and not for others. I have noticed this in all walks of life not only as a civilian but also as soldier.

I think that all men in uniform could unite and be as one after we all shed blood the same. We all must fight for what we love and that is the good old U.S.A. so let us all pull together with a great team and lots of people would like to stay in the army for a  . Prejudice must stop in the army.

q85: My opinion is that conditions in the united states are going to be pretty critical because after shedding our blood, losing our brothers and sacrificing our domestic life we negos aren't coming out of the army to be segregated and discriminated as he done entering the service. Bullets or Bayonetts have no discrimination, my raced died as brave as the white race did therefore there should by a total end to discrimination.Instead of rehabilitating the European Nations less start here and do a little bit of reorganizing along the lines of social equity and social standing. "Why must we die like a white man but still we can't live like one"??? the negro now is educated, enlightened and has opportunities of living in the north and in the south and he knows that these conditions must and or the cause that we have so bravely fought and died for is lost and he must fight his white brother to seek equity. It is my firm opinion that race tolerance should by taught in the homes. It wasn't my fault that I am black or you are white, it could have just as eay been a reverse condition/ (See back of front pages) I, as a negro soldier on behalf of my race ask that there be a national house cleaning campaign against predjudice, and those guilty of such will be persecuted [prosecuted] by law because eventually be bloodshed.

I think the negro race should get more consideration in the army and civilian life, in the U.S.  From what I hear of the southern camps, I think it is unfair. We try to feel as much as a soldier as anyone. We feel that America is the Greatest country in the world. We want to fight for its freedom, we will die for it, but we do want to be considered as an American.  We feel that it is our total duty to put all we have into  the victory. We want to express our ideas and put them to work. We want to present them to the people, to make this a better place to live.  When we get this, then we can be happy and feel that this is a democracy.

I think there are a lot of room for improvement in the arm foces, as well as out. Now sometimes as I go to ork thinking how the minority group is treeted, and what I have to take here in the arm foces it burns me up. Yet still I carrie out my work with the fullest of skill because I am hopping some day we will reach our goal. Doing my army life I spent most of my time in southern camps, and everywhere I've been out group, has always been  returned in accomodations  which has been very difficult  probably not completed with  We have always got to be better than best to compeat with the average white. Take my home state wont let me vote. how do you think I feel about going back to live there. Maybe after I've been in some forgen country dodging bullet and death. There'll be many new problem after the war. and I think if they are not handle right there will be a lot of blood shed.
I feel that conditions in the Army are not as good as I thought they would be.
I don't believe America is democratic as it should be. It doesn't live up to it's written policies. What are we fighting for?
As a Negro soldier fighting for equality of races and freedom of speech & thought. I object to the slights and insults made to negro soldiers.
