We have a group commander that actually hates Negroes & if a officer is assigned to the group that tries to treat you decent, the group commander soon transfers him out. We have had lots of good officers in the group but they can't stay long that is one of the things that had actually turned me against the army. You have no voice as a Negro in the U.S.Army & no equal rights yet you fight and die together.

I think that all people should be given an equal opportunity in all things whether it be educational or labor and especially in the South. In doing this I feel that the majority of the Negro troops would take more interest in the service of these United States which they call their country. Because there seems to be a feeling of their liberating people when they would be under Bondage. As other nationalitys migrate to the U.S. and are given better opportunities than the Negros than have spent a life time here and never railed in arm opposition against the southern white people who would give the same Klansmen who killed of their son an equal chance in any field. And in the Army I don't think there should be any discrimination of any post Camp or station as long as the U.S. soldier is supposedly fighting for the same cause then their should be equality.

Wish to have better understanding with all to whom I may come in contact with. To have all freedoms. To be shown that the job that I am here to do, and am going to do to the best of my knowlege [knowledge] , is and has been appreaciated [appreciated] . Would like some assurance of these things while still on this side  . I am sure that if this could be done, not only myself but my race as a whole, would have the highest morale and equal the best fighting outfits in the Army.

The race problem is very bad in the United States. Actually I don't think the negro has and is being given a fair chance, they strike if he works in factorys his wages doesn't come up to the standing this causing him to have a little chance to get a good education. actually I think the negro has done a good bit for the U.S. far more than he has for any other country as I under stand Russia is writing the U.S. a letter now on race problems now this is also in the army.
I think after the war that all volunteers should be discharged first and that the government do by all as it was said.

I often wondered will it be as now in these united State (racial) The Predjutice [prejudice] which are held even on this army Post there are Signs White only. Negro's Keep out even. Negro Not allowed in Places on the camp. (So. camp Hood)  it does make one feel by what use has he wearing the USA uniform. I don't wear mind [mine] for just a monkey suit which the civillian [[civilian] & officers & enlisted Personell [personnel] of this camp think.  I am for democracy But what is it?
I only hope that each and every one will be recognized and treated as a citizen, regardless of race, creed or color
Give the negro a equal break like you do other races.

Being a negro I am [delete]will[/delete] very much interested the welfare of the negro when this war is over During the last two or three years there have been a considerable amount of reports from different sections of the U.S. of beating, killings or other injustices against the negro soldier even on Army post prisoners of war enjoying certain previliges that are denied the negro soldiers who are fighting and dying for this God Dam country and there's nothing not a God Dam thing being done about it. What the hell are we fighting for? So some son-a-bitching peck-o-wood down in Georgia or Texas can go right on calling us 'niggers' or hanging or beating you up because he's afraid you might fuck a white woman. We don't want your dam women. What we want is an equal opportunity to compete for jobs. The right to raise or family, the chance to help Govern, equal previliges under the Bill o Rights (soldier) or any thing else for the benefit of the soldier. What we want when this war is over is a chance to live by the principles which we are fighting for.

(1) I have been told time and time again that we are fighting to keep democracy in power. Democracy has never been in power - not even in the country of its origination. If democracy means what they say, than the only way it can be attained is through abolishing States' Rights. Follow the Russian procedure: make it a Federal law that segregation toward any race of people is a "Crime" and enforce that law, then we have the "Democracy" which at the present is only a "joke". (2) Consider the problems of the enlisted men in the Army as well as as those of the Officers - too many Officers are beating the Army "rap" for trivial disturbances, while the physical and mental condition of the enlisted men are being ignored. (3) Non-prejudiced Officials should investigate Army Camps more often and more thoroughly to see that certain War Department Directives are being complied with. (4) Remove all incompetent Officers and force them back into the Army as enlisted men. (5) Keep the northern, and eastern soldier out of the south.
I would like to see the nergo [negro] soldier given a better chance in the the army. And given a chance to prove his worth. As a army with his leaders and also out side of the Army.

I would like to no [know] just what are we colored people fighting for. Why I would like to no [know] that is because Some of our white officers say that we colored people dont have anything to fight for. And I dont feel like its right to risk my life for nothing and thousands of others.  I dont feel like or I dont want to go over sea with the officers I am now under. Because I dont like none of them. And I dont like my first Sgt. [sergeant] . His a too [two] face Sunever [son-of-a] Bitch.

I feel that conditions in the United States after the war shall be of such [insertion] that [/insertion] , the average service man who was not definitely set in life before coming into the Army is likely to have a trying time accomplishing the feat of making a living in a secure way unless the Gov't does lend a hand in helping him in ventures that are basically sound for a certain degree of success as a reward.  However, it is my belief that with knowledge of conditions that developed from World War I, the Gov't and the ex-soldier shall be fairly well able to combat them, if steps are taken [insertion] now [/insertion] by both toward combating as counter acting conditions which may arise from this war that would prove disadvantageous to the average individual and populace as a whole.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I consider the army's method for classifying it's men, especially Negroes, very poor to a large extent. For the most part all of the enlisted men are put into service as labor groups which does not give them opportunity to use their talents. I have noticed in my outfit several instances where positions have been  with schooling and given to others who had little or no schooling at all. It seems as if the officers give responsible positions to persons they can dominate, rather than to those best capable for them. I sincerely trust that conditions for the Negroes, as to  security, and social freedom, will be greatly improved after the war. Especially matters of segregation and discrimination in the south. I feel that the federal government can do a great deal to eradicate these evils. Also the army.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: Before I was inducted I was examined by a doctor and put in 1B. I had a very little eye sight in my left eye, broken nose stiff left fingers, 13 bad teeth.I volunteer in the army but the things cause me to be put back 14 months than they sent me a card saying that I was no in Class 1A. I came into the army as drafted the things have not been change as yet my sight will never be made better as the doctor told me so. Still I am in a comfort tent getting ready for oversea duty. DO you think that a man who not sees should than be put in the army a year later as a draftee on the account of the previous things he had in front and still has those same thing. I think that was a rotten deal

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I think some previsions should be made for the educating of all illiterate personal  I think further that the question of segregation of Negros in the army should be given more consideration and done away with through all the army. I do not think the Negroes were given a square deal at the beginding [beginning] of the war neither do I think he will get one after the war; only in part will he be able to live and enjoy the freedom for which he is now fighting.  I think too many soldiers are improperly segregated and placed in the wrong position to enter

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I am sure there is going to be a large well trained army after the war, that will stay in the army, or there will be young men drafted.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: The Army of the U.S. is a very effective organization. It is something to be proud of. I would feel much better I'm sure and maintain that forever talked about esprit de corps if there were more officers in the Army representing my race. It is very demoralizing to train an outfit some period of years in a branch of service that requires great skill and knowledge, and then break up an outfit of this nature to send overseas to do some common jobs as loading and unloading vessels. It's a terrible waste of man power, money and good efforts of our troops who are doing the utmost to win this war.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I don't have any comments to make only the morale of my outfit is very low, for one reason is that our unit Com. [commander] don't give us much  recreation  , and some of them wants to be  moms  . And on the other hand, I am in a camp in the South, and we don't [have] any places much to go. And all of the places are Jim Crowed. We have one seat in the back on the buses to sit on, and on the train we have one coach, it is really hell don't [down] here in the South, that the reason why the colored saides [soldier's] in the South morale is so low. I have lots of other thing I could express but I can not express them in words.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: The matter that concerns me most at this stage is just what is Congress going to do about the negro in the South and the Vetting. I personally  that after I have stayed here and suffered for the cause of victory then I should be given an equal chance in the election of the people that I want to represent me in a democratic Government. I don't think that the president and Congress should play hands off but should take the matter in hand and make some definite decisions. If I am fighting to be denied the right to vote in my state then I pray to God to forbid it.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: My opinion of things after the war are I think after the war living conditions for our race will be better, there will be better Jobs that we may secure. And too after the war the people will not stand for Other people walking over them as before. I think there will be more equal rights. We will all so take advantage of all opportunities ofered moreso than before. As for the Army Regulations they are made for all But in Most Cases it seems as though the colored Race is neglected, and something is added or either something taken away and there fore All the Soldiers are not treated the same. As for this camp Here it sees as thought the peoples here don't want the colored raced here and on the other hand they still continue to send them here. I thinlk if all the soldiers were treated the samegiven the same opportunities the army would be would be much better than it is now.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I think the conditions in the united states should be a lot better for the colored race after the war. The race as a whole should be given the utmost chance to live higher and to make more money. He must be given a chance this time. He should be given more chance for government jobs. The United States should not hold against the colored people as a whole. For what a few people do. About the army well I will just be damn glad to go home for good.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I realize the climate conditions in the South are rather ideal for training, but there should be some recognition of the soldier in uniforms, regardless of race, color or creed. It isn't fully realized that we; the Negro, are giving our lives in a cause to maintain peace, but also in doing that we are being treated like dogs in the South. The State laws apply to the White soldier, but to us it's just a more difficult problem to understand. To the Southern Negro it may not seem so bad, because it has been taught him all his life, that he must address all inhabitants of the South as Mrs, Miss, or more regardless of age so long as the skin pigment is different than his. To me a Northerner, I've been taught to give respect where respect is due regardless of the pigmentation of the skin. I leave this with you who are better suited to take action, and see what you can do.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: All i have to say about the army is it might be better if it was run the "same" all over the United States, instead of just section of the country. In saying this I speak for a colored soldier in the South He wears the uniform, yes, but he don't get the respect and right that uniform should receive this I know as facts.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: All I would like for the colored people to have fair break in all part of the states

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: The average American looks and wonders why the colored soldiers morale is so low. For some strange mystifying reason they send the majority of the northern boys south, where they have to put up with some of the most sordid and morale breaking conditions possible. We are subjected to Jim Crow, inferior recreational and transportation facilities, and in some cases are given some es peckerwood cotton pickers as officers. And still after all of that you people expect us to be bubbling over with military enthusiasim. "It beats the hell out of me"

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: Yes the part of the armed forces I am in now is a combat Bn But will we ever go ever is the question, it is the fact about wanting to fight and loving to fight but, it would be better conditions and ease morale what I mean is this, If we don't go across we still are not good to the negro or we have no accomplished not a dam thing and the white man will say he won the war which would be a dam lie same as the last one, and if we do go across we may be  in a scene of the war which will show that the negroes are really up to date people, and think the same as they do. And then they should do away with this thing called segregation Is in that a hell of a word to have in a Democracy

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I would like to express my feelings about southern part of the United States  I love the united states, that's why I am offering my services to help preserve the things that I love, but I do not love or like the way the colored people of this great nation are treated in the south. I would like to know why are there so much haterd between the "whites" and the "darker" race's of this nation.  The "darker" people have never let this nation down when this nation has needed her help, so if there's any thing any one can do I wish they would do it. for these people are really burden down. give them a chance.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: They could give a sick man some kind of a chance too see a trained doctor. Not one that has been train right along the same time you came in to be trained without a lots of trouble

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: The outfit that I'm in is fine, but it's the people. White eyes. Sneak thefts and the hike. I don't see why in the hell! The see it necessary to send a person to the who has had no dealings with the south. Such things as white here. Colored here. Isn't that a bitch. No amusement on the post at all for the colored troops. Compared to white. If they think that their are mammas little dimple darling and should have everything, let them go over there and get their heads blown off. After all we're supposed to be fighting for "democracy." Then where is it. If democracy is being treated like a dog, being segregated, only allowed to go to certain places, or ride in the back of busses, or a coach with a compartment seating 16 people, well then I don't want any parts of it.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I do hope things will be better all together in general.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: The army would have the negro soldier believe that he is fighting for Democracy. Now does the army think that any Negro soldier after spending 2 or 3 years in the south believes this. How does the United States think they can have Democracy thru out the world and they don't have it right here in Texas or any other southern state. I daily see prisoners of war on this post treated better than the Negro troop. I truthfully believe that the Negro in the south would be no worse off under Nazi Germany or the Japs than they are now. To ask a man to die for a Democracy that does not exist as far as he's concern is as bad as any thing the Japs or Nazis have ever did. The Army should clean up its own yard before it trys to clean up some body elses.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: The war have cause Quite a few things to happen. That I know would not. And I believe after the war where there would be hardship and people with out  labor  . All of that be ironed out before the war is over. Will make things a lot different. And much better living. Because they are all ready planning on helping the soldier after the war which will be the most out of work.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I think the Government should have a large standing army after the war is over.  The government should see that the experienced men get the first preference on all jobs regardless of color and get equal pay regardless of color and also the same conditions or facilities as promised for all in the same  in public places and on trains and Buses.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: The army does quite a bit for some & others it almost reck their lives. Those who can make their self contented with almost anything have no ambition about them self, it does nothing. there are many thing one can lean in the army that will help him in civilian live, but everyone don't get the same breaks. The army has many fault that also go along with it good ones - for instant segeration on army posts The Negroes are usually kept in the South until they are sent across sea. And their is no place for the Negro below the Mason Dixon line. It hard to believe even on army post they are usually segerated. To the extent where they have no amusement at all. I know that are set aside for them are like hat boxes. If we are fight for the Four Freedoms why shouldn't we all be treated alike under the Bill of right.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: If the US government would try and consider certain problems, I think many other  situations could be better.  We of the United states are living in a nation which is considered  in government. Or does this mean just the white . I think there should be quite a change made. Don't you? An American!

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: The only thing I have to say is that I sincerely hope that what ever the minority group is fighting for will someday come to the light and eyes of all (Democracy).

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I have been in the Army for three years. I really think if my discharge is given I should get one and any other service man that in the army now.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I hope conditions will be better for the colored people and hoppe that we can do away with Jim Crowism. And the United States would be a better place to live.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: My opinion is when a man comes in to the Army. The doctors they have to examine you don't give you a very good examination.  Are either after he is in the army. He may go to the doctor and tell him some thing is wrong with him. The first thing he does is give you a lot of different kinds of pills. Without an examination.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: to begin with, I am a Negro Soldier. At present my outfit is preparing for overseas movement. O.K. Now here is what puzzles me. I am  there is only 2 places on the post for Negroes to go to the show, + 2 Post Exchanges for the Negroes. Due to the fact that there is discrimination in civilian life, why is it that we the Negro Soldier as a whole have to put up with it in the Army where all men are considered equal? When we get overseas, color is going to be forgotten. Perhaps we will all fight together on the Battlefield, but here in garrison we are discriminated. I really can't see any sense in having Negro Soldiers if they can't be treated no better than we are at present. It puts me to question some of the training films I've seen since I've been in the Army, "What Are we fight for." I often wonder, what is the Negro Soldier fighting for, because right now, as far as I can see, I would say NOTHING.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I don't like My CO because he dont like us he dont no how to treat us. he has a word he use all the time such as you pleple we know what he mean and when he gets mad he says you God dam pleple that no  way to do men we ar sopose to be fighting for the same thing. he should treat us just like we ar his Brother we stay together and we will have to fight together but instead he treats us like dog. otherwise I like this outfit. but he make my  sprits very low

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I actually feel the Negro soldier is getting a rotten deal, I have more than once experience things to that effect. If the outsiders could see just how the negroes are treated in army camps compared with other troops, it would be hard to believe such conditions would be allower. Here we could not be compared with the prisoners of war and come out on top. They are actually treated like heroes, rather than members of the German's army, who were caught trying to end the life of American soldiers. I know soldier should ber respected after being capture while fighting for their country, but the thing I'm trying my best to get you to see, that we aren't even repsected as being members of the American Army

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: if the war share of the Colored troops troops are being treated is army Reg. it is unfair one thing my Co Commander dont like Colored people and I think the army should have Colored off. for Colored troops.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: Only the Army has no place for me. To much  Predjuce  [insertion] Prejudice? [/insertion]

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: Personally I don't give a damned about conditions after the war in the United States of America. Maybe it's because they were no good before the war. How many times I have heard the words, Sorry don't hire Colored people. So as far as I am concerned they can stick Army, Navy, Marines and the Armed forces up their Asses.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: Conditions in the U.S. after the war will be concerned with the feeling of antagonism , I as an individual feel, and I believe there are others that feel as I do. I honestly feel I would rather fight the peckerwoods, crackers and men that hold up Jim Crow than either the Japs or Germans.  For I've suffered more humiliation from them than I could from this countries [country's] enemies. I could very well understand the axis hate for me and the cause I fight for, but I'll never understand the white man's actions against me. To me the ally of Jim Crow is a hypocrip [hypocrite], and a sinner, for he goes to church, claims belief in God, and yet defies all of God's written words of men are brothers and should love one another. I detest the American people for being a hypocritical people. At least the man that follows the Japanese war lords, thinks he is right in killing us, while I would take more pleasure in slaying a  then Hitler himself.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: The conditions should be better after this war because that is one of the main reason we are fighting. Not for social equality but for right and justis of all man kind, regardless race or creed

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: The U.S. Army is "Damn fine," But Gentlemen there are certain things going on in this Man's Army that I dont like, such as signs stating "White-Only", even in some Organizations on this Damn Post. "Whites here" Prejudice on the Buses, in the Motion Picture theaters, in the P.X's. & Service Clubs. Orders put out By General Ulin, The Adjuant General called Army Regulations, means nothing in the God-Damn South. things of such nature is what brings on riots, etc. Oh!! Yes "Lest we forget", Why are a large Marjority of the colored Combat Outfits being Broken up? Why Mr Stimpson Why?!!

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: The Negro should be given a better chance to live. Down here things are awful, even fore the Negro Soilder

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: Where I am from I think economical conditions will be worse that is the reason I am undecided as to where I'll live.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I only hope the people in the U.S.A. change some of their ways pretaining [pertaining] to a very important subject they have been dodging for a long time. Since I have been in the Army I have some very rough treatment at the hands of these Southern whites. And I will give you my word that After the war if any of my race is molested that I will join any Kind mob or Army to stop who ever is doing it.   Sometimes I wish I was figthing [fighting] the Peekawoods (southern whites) ignorant dogs -- scum. I a glad they don't go the same places I go to --------------period

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: The part that the Negro [insertion] soldier [/insertion] has played in this war, is playing, and will play after the war has been too often neglected. I have been proud to serve in the army of the United States even though there have been times I have wondered if it was worth the time and effort to be a good soldier when even my enemies receive better treatment and consideration and consideration than myself.  I feel that after the war the Negro soldier will demand much more in the way of economic and political privileges for which he as much as any other American has risked his life and thousands of times has given it.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I am a Negro soldier under the leadership of white officers. I know  that my company commander hate negroes. I think negroes should be under negro officers. The post I am stationed at has little or no recreation for us[,] it doesn't have a theater for colored troops, the three thousand (3000) colored troops stationed here have to go to two rec. [recreation] halls for a movie. Negroes have proven that they can do any job given a fair and unbiased chance. I hope the War Department will soon realize that I am aware of the fact that there is no such thing as white supermen. I hope my company commander will go back to school or somewhere and learn that.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: It is my sincerest desire that the aftermath of this war will bring about better social problem  of all races, creeds, and religion, for without this there will inevitably be continuing uprising of an anti-social nature.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: The Army would be a good place for a young man. But this [underline]southern[/underline] state is no damn good for a soldier who tries to be a man for his country. A yankee or a colored man is look upon as a dog. All [underline]southern[/underline] state and some of its people should be burn in hell. The bunch of no good son of a bitches. [underline]Peroid[/underline]

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: There is nothing much that I want to say only that I hope there will be more means of ways for the negro to progress in the south as he should.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I do not like the race segregation of Recreation and other facilities such as: buses and latrines + drinking fountains.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I THINK THAT THE GENERAL SITUATION OF MY COMMENT CAN BE CAPITULATED UNDER QUESTION 79.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: In connection with the army and its policy recreation centers :  I don't think that the great American democracy is practicing half of what she's forever preaching. Segregation in post theaters doesn't help the negro soldiers moral [morale] any. What it does is stops and ask himself - "what am I fighting for? Then when he sees German prisoners enjoying privileges that he is denied. I don't need to tell you that the white man and his friend the enemy soldier, is looked upon as an enemy to be overcome. It will continue as long as the white man tries to hold the negro down.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I never could understand why in the Hell the Army an Government won't do something to protest the Negro Soldier in the South. Of course I know that the South is more powerfull that the Federal government so why doesn't the Government train the Negro soldier in the North since the US government is used or the benefit of the South than for the Nation as a whole. As far as I am concerned the Army is "Chicken Shit" in its policy to put Negros in Labor Company and break up all the Crack outfits the had a no the same thing with them. The U.S. doesn't wise up you may find a War being fought on its own shores.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I would be fine to go back home because the army is not for me

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: Many soldiers feel that the army is not behind them. It fails to protect them from certain unconstitutional laws in many states. Persons who do not respect the uniform we wear, no matter who is wearing it, do not respect this country.  If I felt the army had my interests at heart I am sure I would perform any duty to the best of my ability.  As it is, the only reason I did not seek legal means of evasion of military service is that the nation is in a life and death struggle.  If we  [insertion] save [/insertion] it maybe it will not be too late to make this a true "land of the free" a real democracy!

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I think the conditions in the United States will be fairly good if the post-war plans are put into effect immediately after the war.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: Negro soldiers were not treated as thought hey were here serving for  this country as a Citizen like other nationalites. In many cases they were not treated as good as Prisoners of War. Negros have served (as far as you would let him go) as well as any other nation. Why not give him equal chances on 79% more important things. Let the negro stress to you that he likes being in  the U.S.A. though there are places he could live of fairer treatment. We are fighting our Common enemy there treating each other like brothers; here we  scam  each other. Lets get together the Constructive Way.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: Yes why is it that after this war, if I want to go to school, the government will finance me and my family, but if I want to buy a home they'll loan me. They give to one and loan to the other. Why not loan or give to all alike?  There were men that were recalled to active duty who have no desire to go to school but would like to build a home, one is free the other has got to be paid back  I think the army has forgotten about the Regular Army Reservist.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: Well Sir; All my wishes are now is that the war soon ends and I can either go to a army school of  some money from the government and go back to school.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I have nothing in particular to say since answering your question they covered every thing my  better  I do.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: Because I could rest very easy

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I don't know how conditions will be after the war but at the present time some of the white people are like dogs they are lower than a snakes chest although there are some good white men but they are from the north. The South are no good. Confidentially I think it will be a war here before this one is over between the white and colored. The way I have treated since I been in the army I really don't know what they are fighting the Japs or colored  . I'd fore see I don't give a dam about the army.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: It will be just be a little better for my people but I hope that it will be better.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I think my race will have a little more breaks than before. I think the South will change a little, but it could be better.  I think my races will have better job after the war.  And I think people will see there are a lot of enlisted colored people who can think, act and do anything any other race can do.   I think the ex service men of this war will get a better break than the men of the last war.  I hope and I do think living conditions will be better.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: As to the Army I think it is alright at the time being. But for me after the War I would perfer being a civilian working for the government if I do not go to college. As to the conditions after the war there should be a number of changes. The  good race relationships should be consider much more. One thing I will say I think that every man that served in the army should have a chance at some opportunity or desire that be  long endured to passene. Whether these will happen is a big question. The one big thing is securing a job and whether all the things that was said concerning conditions after the war will prevail.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I like the army alright but I wouldn't want to go through it again

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I think condition will be fair after the war but not too good but there will be some changes after the war is over.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: This one think I work like to see the colored people getting a fair dile when the was is over, and let our people live like other people live.  A think think  would go along very good. And in the man have a fair change as the white people have.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I hope the conditions will be better after the war and every man will get an even brake to do the job he or she is best fitted for.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: The Army is a fine thing to be in, but the army fault I have is the rules concerning the treatment of soldiers are never practiced in most cases. We all are in the Army and suppose to be as one United Nation's Army. Bur are We? Is the Army Jim Crowed? If a man is a man in the Army, why are there reserved seats for (white) enlisted men in the following facilities? Theatres, buses, post restaurant, service clubs and many others? Regardless of the price, after the war, I shall demand my right, not only for myself, but for my race as a whole. After all, everyone has a feeling.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: Well They really don't treat the colored as good as they do the white Soldiers but a soldier should be a soldier regodless to his color So if the colored race were giving more rights I believe that war would end sooner Were fighting with no courage So please give us leqal rights please let the bottom said come to the top and I will bet you the war will end Sooner well no some white people in nice to us but all must unite and we will progress more in the coming days these word is as true as the bible So please take steps on the damn falt

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I think many people standards of living will be better after the war whereas conditions will remain the same  with some citizens.  another opinion is that the United States will face a critical depression within 6 years after Victory.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: No I will not want to enter any more army life. paragraph] and I want to borrey [borrow] some money from the government to bield [build] me a home after the war.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: The Army of United States is fine. It learn you thing you never know before Also make men out of boys I like it very much Mens make army - army make mens Thank you

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: My personal opinion about things after the war are very serious Because of treatment the Negro soldiers are getting in these southern state. Everything is Jim Crowed very bad. But still we are taught that all this is democracy and this is what we are fighting for. But the way I feel now about and go over sea and return I will be willing to fight another war to stop discrimination of races in the south.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: The conditions for Negros should be fair, as of now, in and out of the Army the same unjust, unfair treatments still prevail. Discriminating laws of the south should be lifted and a man living in the U.S. should be able to feel like a man regardless of race or color. After all aren't they fighting & dying for freedom and democracy. Here's hoping to God they will get it after this World war II. Which naturally should exist in a land of Liberty. Nazism will be crushed in Germany. Don't keep it alive here.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I don't have very much to say concerning the army. Perhaps a man with a different attitude, something for the army's good, could say something better. How eager I am to leave the army. The sooner or the better would be highly appreciated. Any young men that love having a private life will and can understand my feeling. I'll say again that there is also too much log rolling  with the army for personal dealings.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I do think the Army life has made true citizens from a lot of young men and when they return they will be better qualified to live as such. Also we are fighting this war side by side and after we have won I think the US should consider if we fight together for a true world in which to live where all men are created equal. Then give it to us. Treat us American Citizens so far as Jobs are concerned and freedom of speech and equal rights. Forget about killing each other especially your fellow Americans forget about linching and lets all live like civilized people for one time cause under the Stars and Stripes.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I would like to live some where in the U.S. after the war. That I am not discriminated and  am  be treated as an American citizen of my country,  If i get just these four  things  , I will be satisfied.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I hope the conditions in the United States after the war will be greater than it was before the war because I want to have my right to anything that I can approval of

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I think that I personally have gotten a rotten deal since I have been in the Army. Because I am a Negro, I have had the chance to really show just what ability that I have and alas when you are in the Air corps you only work for the officers in the mess halls and things. When some men that are not physical fit could do the same job and you could be at a more important job. I think I deserve to be more than a buck pvt.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: After the war I don't believe the colored peoples that are discharged from the army, is not going to have it good brake like the government promised them and they ain't gonna have no rights at all. Why? Because we are the lowed race in the world. And any way the colored are fighting this war like the [insertion] [/insertion] white peoples are  the colored are doing a great part in this war to. And we are looking for rights and freedom and we will get it are die tryin. And you can look for that to happen right after the war you understand what  talk about

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I think there is too much color bar or discrimination according to one's color when all men are dying in this war, regardless of their color. After the war there are some races who will not be satisfied with being put on the back line again after participating in the war. I look for a civil war in the States if there are not a lot of changes made. There are a lot of people who will not put up with the treatment they received in pre war days.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: Well that be so that a soldier in start a business & hope he able to get as much money as he wants to.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I think if things go on much longer like they are now, my job wont be of any use to me after the war is over.  I have seen things happen since I been in the Army bad enough to make a man  forget about his future plans. I also hope the Army will not drop the law about helping the ones that wanted to through school.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I would liked to go back to school   five more year after the army I would like to finish high school and get my college degree.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I really hope after this war, the Negro will be treated like he is a human being in stead of a slave, and again may I say I hope too that the negro will really get a break of the mess is all over.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: The question that on my mind is why so much Jim Crow in the army. I know it has come down a whole lot in the war then last but still it could improve.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: After the war I think every man regardless to wehere he is stationed have his share of wealth. At the present we are in new orleans and they really give colored soldiers a rotten deal after all we are fighting for the same thing but the Southerns do not seem to think so. But I do hope in the near future things will be different.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I think after the war that transportation facilities should be changed. I think a person should sit down any where he or she can find a seat regardless to crede or color. Descrimination should be done away with.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I would like to say that I think the army should help all men who is going to try to return to college in all ways possible. For after all these are the men who will be the future builders. As for my self personally all I want is a chance to return to college. I have noticed several soldiers who have returned from overseas and the way they are treated is ashame. I think the higher ups should investigate different camps, and put an end to the unfair deals these soldiers are getting its a damn shame and most of them are only young men who should be given all the help possible.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: It could be better after the war. Better than it was before war and why is war going on

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I dont understand why the army sends the Northern Colored man to the South when the Southern Whites dont like them and they try to make it hard for you although you are fighting for what is supposed to be your country. And why dont the Army do something about the Jim Crow problem for the soldiers.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I sure hope negroes get a better chance after this war because we have did a very important part in help winnning it and we wont have to go home and be denied the same privilege as a white soldier and I do hope we will get a chance to bring some of those Bastards in the south to justice that killing negroes and think nothing of it. One thing I am almost positive of and that is if a negro get his equal rights the people of the world will see howe we will go to the top and qual any race on God's green earth.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: Since being in the Army I've had many headaches. I have given my life to preserve freedom - the cause for which we fight. But I've seen dam little freedom. I have been stationed around army prison of war camps and seen the Italian prisoners of war get more freedom than so called free Negroes. After the war I'm worried about whether our enemy the Germans and Japs will be permitted this freedom in their country with freedom to do where they please. Then I wonder if I'll be able to intermingle. To have the freedom for which I a now fighting. Will my present enemy hold the hammer over my head as an American citizen?  Will congress pass the Anti lynch bill? Will such senators such as "Bilbo" Jackson and Carter gloss with their damn racial attitude remain in the house? Will a bill be passed ending segregation and discrimination? Will I return to civilian life with all freedoms or will I return with a hammer hanging over my head and my enemy be of the nail drivers?

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I think all the young men shoul at lest get one year of R.O.T.C. course. It will  Co because it will  the caring  Mitary

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: The Army isn't what it should be they I am a fighting for Jim Crow instead of peace. They should get things straight here and practice what they preach. I am a soldier just like any one else but dont have the privilege.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: It is only thing I have to say about the army after the war that is to give every man a chance to deside what he are going to do before he leave after. Give all soldiers the money back the have spent in Insurance and that will be all the money a soldier will need to start any Businesses he would to do. If the army do that ever Soldier would be Happy.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I think things will be better for me and for the negro because the negro has been able to show his or her capability in this war & also they have shown such a improvement until there is no doubt left in any minds or head of the White race which can be said or talked about other than the ideal that the negros well learned & well qualified for any job or duty put before him or her.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: As a whole the Army would be much better if they would start doing things right instead of doing things the wrong way most of the time. I thought the Army would set an example of equality for all but so far, all that I have seen, was nothing but Partialty and Jim Crowism.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: The way I have been fuck around here is the army I won't stand to be push around after the war, and I think there are a lot of colored fellows feel the same. We might have a nother war to fight, but we will if it take it to not be push around again.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I hope times won't be as hard as they were after this war as they last one.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: Give the Negroes the same rights to have the things he is fighting for. Help him to become a proud  citizen of the Nation he was willing to die for

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: About going to school after the war, is a very good idea if it will go threw. I would like to have a chance at it.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I am a negro soldier, the other day I heard a street car operator down town say "all niggers will be killed after the war". I know he was a dam lie and told him same but that doesnt help a man & morale any to hear. People say some  thought.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: About this going to school I think that wide be a grand ideal if it come to pass even if I do miss out on it but after all some one will get the chance.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: First I would like to say that so far as I ask concern camp plauche it aint shit no way form or fashions far the simple reason it contain to many chicken people. But I still say that Army is alright.

ant but just this I think the army shuld get men that is in good health but the best  men  you can see them every day you  go  to town. I not no count what every I am just here because the army wont let me out after this war I think it will be better

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: On the whole America and their Army is the Best in the World although there are some very bad points about it. For instance the signs in the camp bus "White front Negro Back" that isnt necessary. We are all suppose to be as one regardless of color or creed not that I would like to be around them all the time but give us the choice to see that by our fighting we are making a better world for our children to live in. One more thing the officers here in Plauche some I'll say have a tendency to just curse soldiers every time you make a formation even if you do something wrong they talk as if you had no feeling at all. They must remember that we too are fighting for a cause.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: While I was in the army things were okay, but now I am in the Boy Scouts and it ain't worth a damn. I haven't had any morale since I came to this branch of service. This branch can go to hell.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)

If the majority of the white people feel that way toward us, it is going to be hard for us to better our condition after the war, but  if each individual have the courage we will succeed in making things better.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I thank that the jim crow [Jim Crow] condition should be stoped [stopped] after the war if possipble [possible] befor [before] .  It would make a great change in the United States. Every one should have equal rights.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: Yes! Negroes in this war are apprehended from the start. They take New York or Northern boys and send them to the south. Why not leave the northern boy up north and vice versa. The average Southern boy will get less after the war, because the south is building plans already to apprehend them. The average Negro fighting the war doesn't know what he is fighting for. Ask him and see? Camp Planche is a hell hole and not fit for dogs. The barracks are filthy and they don't even bother to rid the barracks of the filth. The Govt. should inspect this camp, I am sure if they did they would close it up.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: My only comment is that after we have so proudly given our Blood for a Just &  Peace that those who's job it is to prepare the same will do an equally job so that our childrens children in teh generations to com will not be engaged in another war because the Peacemakers of the one were too selfish or blind or incapable of taking charge of a victory that was paid for by Blood

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)

Why  isn't something done to get the "Anti-Lynch Bill" and the "Poll Tax" Bill out of Congress. If this Country be Democratic why is there so much segregation in Federal organizations. The Army definitely included. Why do the Whites enjoy privilidges that we, as Negroes, doing the same things they are; sacrificing as much - more comparatively - are forbidden. document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I think that the Negro should have Economic Equality with the white man, & to be able to vote in all states without paying poll tax. The South should be made to  its Jim Crow laws. The government should build more projects for them to life in, more schools, and places of interest so that the standard of living could be raised to the average American. All this could be done by a true democracy witch [which] we do not have. I thank you.
