document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: Will the army really effect discharges 6 months after the duration or will it insist upon a force of occupation made up of those who would rather return to civilian life? Will the duration be when the enemies sign to unconditional surrender? Will race relationships, especially between the whites & colored be bettered after this war are will the politicians and those who have not personally felt the effect of the war try to create a strain on race relationships. If that be their intention then for what is the minority race fighting for. Is the Negro to be like dumb driven cattle, fighting to help other to obtain freedom and themselves loose it. I feel some those who have faught side by side regardless of race or creed will rise in revolt for freedom must be complete even here at home if it is to mean anything. Despite the one sided treatment the Negro soldier receives, despite the segregation, he has always proved himself a good soldier and a true American. The army and the government have fallen down in that they have the ways and means to create the existing conditions but apparently not the desire.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: First, I will say that to my beliefs the army doesn't seem to much interested in how and where they place men. That is they give very little thought to qualifications of most of the men that come into the army. Second, there is great delay in paying the soldier in many parts of the country, yet during this time he [the soldier] must keep clean by all means, and take care of other personal necessities. The headline topic for discussion is "the Place of the Negro After the War." During these troublesome times The Negro is still consider the inferrior when all the time he is trying to do his part so that after the war he can enjoy a better place [insertion] in which [/insertion] to live. He is doing his part, yes, but what does he get in return. He is turned away from public places with the excuse that "We do not accommodate Negroes." His uniform is torned from his back, given punishment for having a mind of his own and called abusive names by supposedly intelligent superiors. Is that the type of place that I've been selected to shed my blood for? Why not "right" the "wrongs" at home before trying to spread our good thoughts to others.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I like the war alright in some cases, nothing hard about it. All except you have to do as you are told to. I don't have any personal bad afairs about the army, just it is very hard, when you first entered, and cant go home when you get ready, and cant stay out long as you wish, But it dont hardly bother me much. I don't like it at all, but for as I'm in it I will have to like it? So thats all I have to say about the army.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I personally do not think that the US Gov believes that they are allowing the American Negro the chance he deserves. Those hard fighting patriotic American Soldiers can not return home from overseas and enjoy the things they have fought and die for freedom. The Negro is conscious of whats going on he is also familiar with the Constitution and he know that the Four Freedoms don't apply to him yet he fights to perserve them. He know there is no equality in any sense of the word and I fear there will be quite a bit of unrest when the Negro boys come back. They're not fighting to perserve Jim Crow, nfair employment practices and the right to pay taxes and not the right to vote. The Negro can't take anything from the white man. All he wants is to be left alone and live like any other American citizen. Why can't the Negro have Franchisement. Why can't he compete. Why can't there be Negro Commanders in the Armed Forces.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I think that the condition + the way that soliders [soldiers] are treated in Camp Planche should be  corrected  because it is geting [getting] worse instead of better especially in this camp. After all we all are human + we should be given a fair chance in any thing + I will be happy if something is done about this case the way we are treated. I mean the colored soliders [soldiers] . It is a pity + as long as thing go like they are The country never will be like it should.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: In the Army and out the Army: all mens are created equally. But I dont see where that exist All of us fight and die God dont have no sergation no Presint or head official exist like our Creator. I will  like to live free from fear + have my freedom of speech. Where no despiraton will confuse a good Caunsious. Give me justice out or in the Army. Justice mens is all I ask. I will fight the war just as my health able me to fight until I cant rase my gun, to fight no more. I am fighting this war for my people that they may live and never die.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: A hand  Plauche  I am in physical condition except my head I have a fractured skull but if you are sick down here you cant get any kind of good treatment . I  wanted  life for the next generation of the Negs to get to the top, +[and] have  people to respect them as the respect the white, all of this yes sir and no madam. I think this a dirty shame you are a man when you reach any so  ach  as a man the white are men when they reach Any Age so hear no better than I the south as a whole is not up to standard they should be allowed a little more rights and stop so much Jim Crow. I dont want to mix with the white, but I do want to have the rights and privelidge the white have let my race advance a great deal more.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: All soldiers should go in any public place in the United States that they desire, and all people should be equal according to their ability, no people should be segregated according to their race. In the United States a man should be a man with equal opportunities regardless to his race creed or color.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: There is only one think I would like most of all to say and that is I think the Negros should be treated as real Americans now and after if this is so much of a "Democracy" Its true that there are a few Negros who are not worth going out and fighting for but there are some in other races alike.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I would like to see my race of people get the same treatment after the war as the white people do. I would feel very bad to know that I fought in this war and that my children didn't get any better breaks than I did. If even if they had better schooling than I did. The camp & State that I am in don't seem to like the Negro soldier and they are fighting the same way. The camp that I am in treats the men as though they dogs.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: The Negro soldier deserves more credit than he is now receiving. He is not getting a fair and square deal like white soldiers although he is sacrificing his life and future like the white man.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: Before the war I dont think I was treated fairly, and I dont think it will be any different unless something is done for the Negroes equal rights. I dont like camp Plauche [New Orleans, Louisiana] and I dont like New Orleans. As for the camp theres nothing here to keep up the morale of the colored soldier. And in the city of New Orleans, the soldiers are treated much worse than the civilians. One store refused to sell me a cigar because I was a colored soldier. If thats the way we are going to be treated I'm still waiting for someone to tell me what I'm fighting for.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I would like to make a comment on the food. The potatoes are not peeled right half skin on them, your trays are still greasy after they are washed. The whole mess hall stays dirty roaches and ants crawling in all over the walls ceiling + floor while you are eating even on the tables. I would like to see the food inspected and served in a general house clean in the mess hall which would mean a healthy soldier.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: There is only one thing and that is they make Camp Pluash [Camp Plauche] a better camp. Stop all the Jim Crow in Savana. All men are supposed to equal but here they are not. In other words have it stopped all over the United States.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: One thing I think should be made clear when the war is over and that is the negro should be treated the same as the white race. It is spoken of in this war that we are living and fighting for democracy and there  the war is over why can't the whole United States living in a era of democracy. Another is that all negroes should be allowed to participate in the government and have the same equal rights and allowed to vote. Another is segregation should cease.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I am quite sure after the war that if the attitude toward the negro is not changed he is most likely to Be in a worse shape than Before it all Point to the fact as to the way thing ar still going I have seen quite a few thing that happens that I know wasnt  right for instance one of the Higher up in the Gov affairs said that a Negro wasnt good for much of any thing in the  army  so if they still have that attitude when the war is going on then most surley will have it after it is over and it all Point to different thing that I see in Camp  Plachne  But I do Believe or say to Back up my answers to question I have answer I would Be of more use in civilian life to the gov than in the army  Because if a man is not instred in what he is doing he most  certainly won't put out good work I am not intrested this work not nearly as much as my cilivlan work and RR work at Present is very  important to the gov.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I think all married men with children should be station as close to their home as possible. After the war they should be the first to be discharged, then older me. The young single men last[.] I think that there should be equal rights for every man. I dont think any  peoples  should be judged by his race or [insertion] color [/insertion] . I think that every one should have a chance to vote.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: Truthfully speaking I believe that after our war the negro soldier will not under any circumstances except the treatments rendered negro soldiers after World War I. After all if this country is victorious, which I have every reason to believe she will be, the negro will have played just as important a part as anyone else therefore he should be considered rightfully in anything that is unfortaken. Rather than suffer race prejudice after this war I would die gladly fighting the people of this country for the things I think are right. If there was no other way out. Even tho I should lose my life fighting for rights someone sooner or later should be benefited. As a whole the U. S. is pretty fair but there are some places within the boundries that could stand a damn could cleaning. I for one would like to help with that cleaning and help make this country a really democratic place to live. A country where you fellow man is your friend and neighbor.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85) [cont.] A continuation page
q85: I think the average G.I. is okay and is sincere about winning the war but with people who have money and seem together together in order to control a state or sections of our country hte army doesn't mean a damn thing. If it did they would pass the soldier vote bill would always 18 year olds to vote regardless of race. The superior officers in the army from marshall on down would come out boldly for equal rights for all instead of appearing to the man with the money. Before I came into the army I thought this was a peoples' war. I know it's one in Russia, France, and in the Balkans but even here it's the same old routine. Flag waving and the person that waves the flag is the first one to holler "niggers in the rear". I don't think the Negroes should start a war over here to gain all their rights but those people that believe in Democracy would become better organized and advocate those that fell for Hitler stooges over here (Henry Ford, Pew, Dupont, Martin Dies, Fish, Dewey, Hoover, Hearst, McCormick etc.) because there are the fellows that furnish the govt propaganda, etc. to carry on race riots, cause confusion, etc. There are the guys that ought to be lined up and shot because (over) they are the ones who found the would be Hitlers over here like Gerald L.K. Smith, Father Coughlin, K.K.K. Silver Shirts Drew (N.Y.) So since this is a Peoples' war these gutter native Fascists + their stooges should be exterminated because they are no better than Quisling of Norward, Laval + Petain of France. After this is done in every country (it doesn't have to be done in Russia) mass education should begin to teach white + colored to respect each other as they are both equal and a war was fought to prove that there was no master race. I could write all day and all night about my opinion) and would gladly sign my name) but this is all the paper

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: Camp Pluache [Plauche] aint shit. I go to the dispensary for back and heart and the people cuss me out I was here in another accident in 1933 and motherfuck cuss me  out and I do have to take that shit motherfuck wihte [insert]people[/insert] is a Bitch

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I think that the boys over seas that have been there at least two years should be relieved from the army after the war if they may have such and idea to do so.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: On condition after the war in southern states it should be something done toward the negroes for they is playing a great part in the war looseing their sons as other races are doing and working hard as others are doing all men should have equal rights if not equals far beyond what the negroes are getting and before the war. In other words the best would be equal right to all.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I some time wonder if the white + colored races will have an evil heart after fighting the war together, Both races for victor as it is now. It should not be, but I think it will

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I have been down here in Camp P New Orleans 12 L.A.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I am praying and hoping I will be given some consideration after the war more so than before

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I think the united states is in a  wicked  condition and the people ought to pray more  than they do.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: Well the army would be all  right conditions war prove in so camp such as condition of the built was fix up & give a person either food & not so much extra duty. but other wise in so ok.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: In the United States after the war, the negro should have a better chance to fulfill the  position  and do the job which I he is fitted for[.] His rights should be also equally balanced.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: for the present time I wish I were out of the army because I don't like it at all. and that is finally.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I think the war of Prejudice of which the South is carrying on for White supremacy is worse that the Present war. Millions of lives will be lost but to no avail. Blood is being Spilled useless in the Great Catastrophe. we will win the war but I am uncertain about winning the Peace that follows. There are so many things carried on Racial affairs (Especially by men like Bilbo and Calton EO Smith) that would cause us to fall short of a lasting Peace. Segregation and racial Prejudice have been Increased 100% Since the war. Our papers, magazine and other literature have been running over with Japanese atrocities and the over running of China. But this is only a dream to compare with the atrocities of the Land and the free and the home of the Brave.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: Personally I think that All Service me should Be given the first chance. At the job they want. If they cant get that job I think the Govement [Government] should see that they get a job that pay them a high saluery [salary] . And men wanting to By homes I thinks some way should be made for them to by them from the Govement [Government] (on a credit.) Base with payments cut. low enough for them to meet with ease.  I think up on a man geting [getting] out of the Army a job should be given him at once.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: i hope thangs will be better for my race brake wee do not get fare brake down in the South  i wish some one wood do something about it

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: The army is fine and long as I am in it I am going to serve my country the best of my ability. But as being the type of person that is doing what I am told to do when it should be done. I think state laws should be done away with so a person like this will feel happy, when riding buses, trains and trollies. Just bel allowed a chance as being a citizen of America.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I am a negro, I live in the South, the state of Louisiana. After serving three or more years in the U.S. Army, I think we should be given more consideration in a lot of things than we are getting. Such as jobs and the freedom of speech. And the right to do the things I want to, without being pushed back by a lot of foolish State laws. I was good enough to be taken in the Army, I ought to be as good out of the Army. I think the Federal Government should help out in this case.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I think all severe [service] men should be given government jobs.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: My only hope is that things would be better for me after the war than before then I will know for myself that our colored boys did not die in vain for in this state of Louisiana I've applied for a job my answer in return from the foreman was ["] We dont hire niggers on this particular job["] And right here in this particular camp we dont have the privileges the other fellow has although we are serving in the same army. So speaking of a soldier's morale we colored have a lot to contain [contend] with when we think of how we was treated before the war and now in camp. So all that helps to tear down a soldier morale especially mine. When one does you contain things just on account of his rank etc.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I have ben In Bails for some time. I havent got my pay since out, 1943 partial payment of 5- and $10 Some unpaid a  I havent got anything they fine me to much only get 28, after my wife  took oath Not Bounce up other Bail $33.33 a month twice and I think I have got a Bad Brake after all I am willing to do all I can for my company, But I havent had a fair Brake  I will

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I think the United States should keep a standing army after this war much longer than the pre Pearl Harbor Army as we would be much better prepared for future wars if there be any. I would like to have better conditions or understanding between the Colored and White races in the United States especially in the Southern States. Give us a chance to vote, equal rights, social equality. As for the war I think we are doing a good job of it, was a little late starting but production and manufacturing of war materials is at top peak, and man power no limit.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: To much Jim Crow in the South negroes dont get any thing what they are fighting for

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: What cause difference in Races I think the whole matter is some white & colored too need more education. If not the war may last a very long time since as  &  Officer at this Camp Need Better Training Where I was trained we had better officers who knew what they are doing. New officers with little  ruin the morale of good NCOs & EM under them Why or Colored sol discriminated with White. We have to dig our fox together & fight to gether Why not ride on Gov Transp & us Gov. owned property together. The State of La run this camp I have a good Command officer of the Company & the post too but they alone cannot not solve our problems. Are we to be Segregated after the War if so it Will never end. More School is needed for the ignorant White & Colored We are are Wrong & they are to in some cases but we are all Human.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: Yes under one  suparon [/unclear ] the state of luosaina. They don't give  C  the soilder no right at all a cause to the second  s  of the proffile of a  of soilder  it is really a disgrese thing to go through with at  time Y  man as soilder be leave he should have the right to any thing that come the hand

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: What will happen to me after the war. will I retreat, will I  a change at the 71 How long will I have to will I get the correct discharge and  have to  that  and the south is  I hope the war will hurry up and end so all the boy can come home

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: Personally and frankly speaking I feel that conditions after the war will be worse for us, "the negro." That is mainly your belief because of the national increase [in] prejudice, a hatred the war itself has brought on. Instead of becoming more cooperative, doing a way with so much discrimination, etc., as will be ever so necessary before that world peace and bauble victory that we talk about is attained. The people of the country are getting worse. CAN'T YOU FOLK REALIZE THAT THERE MUST BE A MEETING OF MINDS IN ORDER TO DO THIS JOB?

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I do think the collared man should have a chance to hire [insertion] and [/insertion] chance to demand his writes that we don't have in the South land [insertion] and [/insertion] writes to get jobs under a decent job scale that we don't have freedom to  B  freedom from want freedom from fear that we don't have in the South land

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I have a few questions that is in my mind. Will we as a negro race be ruled and goered under the same constitution as any other American? Will we be given the rights to live and die as any other American? Sometimes this situation looks doubtfull down here.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I think that after this war inwhich we are all engaged in, is over. It would be no more than right for each & every man of the armed forces that are willing to work or apply for any position that he or she thinks he is capable of holding, regardless to race, creed or color; We should be given equal opportunities as to his appliance.  Because its going to be hard on some of the men or most of the men as to getting there moral up to where they left it in civil life before entering the Army. We, whom are colored, should be given great opportunities such as the other nationalities of the United States in which we are all protecting are paying the great price to live in. The doors should not be closed to the colored man, but began to open.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I am stationed in Louisiana - New Orleans, and the way these white people try and do treat negroes is disrespectful. The only thing we do is kiss their asses. {illegible] this can't last forever.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I have had a fair deal only that Army should give men with are poor physical condition jobs which they can do instead Civilians which are in better shape than some of our men to getting easy jobs of the post as driving  stop cars etc. in past the whole camp here is runned by civil law and a soldier hasn't any rights civil police  comes right on the post and takes soldiers to jail thats not the "army?

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: Well I think that the united states should continue to train new men after the war that haven't had any military training and I also think since the men that are in now are doing such a fine job I think that the men that put up service in the army should get a fair deal by the war department and get a break in the first  . That's my idea

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: It is my personal opinion that many times the Negro Race is misunderstood by the opposite race in this manner: The negro in general desires economic equality rather than Social.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: The army is too discriminating - here in this state especially

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I think that the Negroe soldiers should have just a much of freedom and equal rights to anything in the United States. For we are in the service doing all we can as well as the White. When this has been gone in effect we will have a much better Army and Country. For God is no respector of persons but he that worketh righteous is accepted with him. So thank you. And may God's sweet blessing remain on our land and country May God Help you. Thru Jesus Christ our Lord - Amen.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: The idea of congress turning the G.I. Bill of Rights over to the states to  run  was a very unfair act toward the negro soldier

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: As the army is concerned, my opinion isn't too good right now about it. I have been a soldier 22 months and there are still some places in this camp I can't go. Yet there are Enemies Prisoners of war here can go to them. I am in this thing to help this country not distroy it, yet I can't go to verious places when Enemies P-W are in this war to Destroy this country have opportunities to go where they're  . This is my house state, and it stinks. We ride on the camp bus and have to set in the back, which have about 5 sets, for colored where there 5 empty seat, left for white. What are we colored soldiers fighting for? White supemicy?

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: DISGUSTED WITH THE WAY NERGO ARE TREATED IN THE ARMY. My believe in that "Any man that is good enough to offer up his life in defense of his country should receive a  deal from that country, no man should ask more, no man should receive less. WE NEGRO will not put up with the present conditions in the United States after the war, regardless of the outcome. WE NEGRO have prove that we any perform any task better than any other RACE when given equal opportunity.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I dont think Negro personal are fairly treated in the Southern camps in some camp that have signs for White man and for colored men witch dont suppose to be in army camp

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: There is to much discrimination between Races in the armed forces. And inlisted has too little Rights. [Paragraph] After the war colored should have the same Privilages as others.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: If not farming or mining I would like very much to have a government job of some kind. I have nothing to say against the Army, but I am not a well man and neither do I like it here in the South. As for the Army I could stay in it if I was in the North somewhere I have been here 2 years and only had 23-days furlough have been a good Soldier in fact all of the Soldiers in the Camp any are good Soldiers but we do not get the kind of Justice that is due us as American Soldiers. But I hope some one can see my side and help me in getting transferred north.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I''m from California but so far I've spent most of my time in the south. If all southern states are like Louisiana & Miss. I think they should be put out of the union. The camp I'm in now is nothing but the Alcatraz of the South. War prisoners live better than a negro soldier. They also have to damn many southern white officers  who think the civil war is still being fought. I think the camp needs cleaning out. Here a black soldier is less then a dog. P.S. Run out of paper but not words.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I figure conditions are bound to be awfully critical after because every one isn't going to be able to work after the war lot of us will return home physically unfit, and that will bring about a great handicap towards opportunities, such as making the best of jobs. Thus I think especially any man that does be able to work try to save for the thougher [tougher] day. Each and every man should think now because things are though [tough] enough now in some of the southern camp for us. We know what we face as Soldiers and thus we know it will be though [tough] enough as hell a civilian.  Thanks.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I am speaking of question No 79 I am a colored man and this is what I cant understand Why you are in Generaly put in  these  labor Battalions I think we should at least be given a 50/50 chance I don't think we Should be given All the back Breaking work and poor chances at other things. And  about  after the war I hope we  want  be given a pick and Should  and  be told thats what we learned in the army.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I think the army haven't given the colored [insertion] soldiers [/insertion] a square in the armys,   an their people, in its defenese for products plants of the colored soldiers and their parents should an talk with some of  close, colored soldiers, officers, friends, white or colored, and tell that we want fair employment for our people, an, also an equal is the american   house,  ,  an the soldier asked his officers to the comander in chief of american army to help us get priviliges it mentioned above, an the colored soldiers relatives to asked, thier states congressional district when they know well to help the colored people an their soldiers, sons, to get the priviliges I mention above.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: The Army as a Whole is too prejudice against Negro personell, it could be and should be stopped. The negro soldier is good. he can take it and would take it, but what is he going to get out of it discrimination and hate. he dont do all he could do. to-wards the War effort here is What the average Negro thinks Why should I die for men such as Bilbo. Rankins. Gerald L.K. Smith and John H. Overton and a few others With their cry of keeping NIGGERS in their place and white supremecay.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I hope we Negro will have a better say so after the war then they did before the war.  An all so my  self  since I have since in the war

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: This war should learn all of us a thing or two.  We must co-operate more together instead of fighting and watching each other, we should watch the other countrys. We must remember that a man is a man regardless of race, creed, or color. We will never get any where until we learn that. We are too busy fighting each other, to win from the other man. We must prepare for war in the time of peace, but we can't do that watching each other.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: In certain sections of the country conditions need changing badly

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: From present and past indications I do not think that the lot of the negro citizen of U.S.A. will be influenced as much as (st) could be due to prejudice of from white southerners and other  persons   such as labor  who support the cause of the so called "white supremacy element in this country. We as negro citizens [underline] do not [/underline] want social equality but equality of opportunity and advancement on our merits and experience and any other qualifications we have. We are helping to fight and win a war to defend a "democracy" we do not enjoy. We do not ask for any thing more than a chance to prove that it is not a "white woman" we want, but a better way to improve our homes and surroundings. Recognition of our talents and merits is what we want more than any thing else.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85) [cont.] A continuation page
q85: I have very few comments to bring fourth because I haven't been to any other army post other than this one. But I can state about his one in short. I have never heard of Seragation [segregation] in any army camps. [cont.] The main thing is the practice of White Supremacy in the army as a whole. I think the army is the last place there should be segregation and the practice of white supremacy.  Mea   No 82 Camp  P  has helped some but is didn't go  deep  enough. The majority of the officers of today are not as good as some of our s[er] g[ean] ts & c[or] p[ora] ls but they are supposed to be our leaders & superiors & they don't know how to hold an interesting conversation. In other words a figure head. On the other hand they think too much of their selves & not enough of the men. If things & conditions remain the same in the south after the war as they are [insertion] now [/insertion] there is the chance of another civil war. In conclusion all we want is equality & just as fair a chance as the white man & we want to be respected as citizens of the U. S. and have the white public realize that we fought as  much  as they did to win this war even though we were held down + made most of our outfits work outfits and   served  in any army. We hope that the war dept. [department] will provide equal opportunities for all and maintain the justice that we are fighting in   +  keep  . Remember this, "All men are created Equal" who said that a white man or Colored? What is wrong can't people  + their own beliefs? Give us soldiers an equal chance to prove what we can do. document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: Well I don't like the army especialy down here in the South. I don't see why they have to  see  men from other states to this place. I think they can train them just as well where they were when they were drafted.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I do believe the conditions after the war with me will be very bad in getting a good job, equal pay and State protection. I believe I will be barred from to large or fine a garage as I me able to work and build, due to my race. I be ( as before) other races will get the best as a whole. I do believe to know a good trade, be your own boss, own your own home and business is the only mean of a fair living for my race of people after the war, if the country doesn't get any better than it is now and before the war. Jobs and equal pay is sure to be a problem to solve, if the US continue as before the war.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: The conditions of La could be a lot better then it is it's  every way the hours is to[o] long

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I have noticed in the two years I have been here that the   New Orleans are runing this camp like they want it to run instead of  the way the army want it. We are almost forced  the officers of this camp to not do some things that the army wants done just to satisfy the city of New Orleans.  We are forced to show civilians of New Orleans all the resect but they only show us the respect that they would probably show any of the lowest grade animals. I would bet money that colored soldiers are showed with less respect in this place than any other part of the U.S. As a whole the people in Washington don't know half what goes on down here. Well I don't have any more room to write

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: Conditions here in the south are not so good for colored troops. There are lots of discrimination and segregation in most southern Army camps, such as riding horses and even in using latrines on some posts here. I think things of that nature should be straightened out. For after all, we are fighting principally for the same cause. I am hoping after the war they will have an equal opportunity, and at least be recognized as citizens of the United States.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I do not think that lot of the Negro will be better after the war in Southern States. Due to Predujice [Prejudice} in the South.  We are fighting for a Democracy we do not enjoy: Which is Freedom & Justice to all men  We dont have it here, I do think that more Education and love for our fellow men would solve the whole problem.  When we think of the right, and work to the interest of our fellow men there will be better living in our land.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)

I feel pist about like a man that's thrown away in the God dam army  Would like to get transfered back medics  Dam the state of Louisiana I don't like the way these crackers treat negroes.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: They do not treat no man who is sick like he should be treated; they often refer to him as a gold brick.  The way Negro soldiers are treated here I do not know what I am fighting for.  I have been treated like a damn dog.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I like the army pretty well. The food and clothing is OK. They have a pretty fine camp here. I like it fine. Initials.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: First I don't see why a Negro soldier riding on an army bus has to ride in the back when a German or an Italian soldier who have probably killed and beaten up your brother, or mine, ride in the front. In fact they should send a army this way instead of going oversees. The whole army, the White Southern bastard, Navy, Marines and all can kiss my BLACK ASS. P.S. A person like Senator Bill Bo I would like for him to suck my dick.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I don't think that we get the food that we should get here in this outfit. I don't think they give you enough time off, they keep you confined to duty too often I don't think the soldiers have enough recreation. You don't get a leave like you should get in this camp here. Personally I think my transfer from the Air Corp to a post Co. was a rotten deal. I like my previous camp much better than this one. You are treated more like a soldier. There they would give us some kind of entertainment ever so often. Things of that sort makes you feel more like being in the army. Where they  desire  you & continually keep you on duty makes you feel as if you are not a human.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I would want my legal rights after I get out the army because I figure I will deserve them.  I do not get a pass as often as I like and I think it is a poor system about giving passes.  In many places my race is not treated as it should be.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: There are important things about the army that I do not understand. A man can't read or write has no business in the army, because he can't understand anything. I'm not saying that cause I want threatens with, I like the army alright, but the important thing about the army, is you have to read to understand it. I just can scribble my name. Such as my reading I don't understand any of it. I can only understand it if someone can explain it to me. There is no one to explain it to me, right, because they are always in a rush. The people here have very little patience. I have been to whoal for 3 months. The only thing I learned was how to wish my house I don't even know my ABCs. Locel in heaven knows I tried to learn had you time no there to learn. Do you think I should be in the army? Of course I like it through, cause there is a job for every body.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: Every thing will be O.K., only if the members of my race, the Negro race, can get a square deal then they are getting now. I am not positive about the possibilities of the squarer deal but I do hope and pray that it will come about.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: Volunteered for the Navy and I was sent to the Army. Army life is not so hot. Rough life doesn't agree with me.

After all I think all the people shood get save and forget wars. JESUS is able to ceep peace for us if we trust him. he is the Prince of Peace.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: Being in the Army has helped me to grasp the thing I would want, and those I am sure I will get after the war. Now after the war - in my own opinion I believe working and living conditions after will be much advantage to some people because they have learned to co-operate and to  t  , and some have a better idea of living in  sanitary  places.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: The Army is for those who like it  But for me give me  goodie  life  The NEgro does not get the opportunities to which he is entitled. I know four lieutenants who would be swell if it were not for a southern officer who tries his damnest to run things in the Company. The Army food is lousy and the ambient given us wouldn't fill a baby. Cooks don't fix the food properly no seasoning at all. We are fed in the mess halls like dogs. Work all the dam day and no dam passes at night. We work hard and long but are they satisfied Hell no! Down South in the Army men are treated like dogs.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I think that this country will be a better place to live in after the war.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: After the war the men who have been in the war should be given the jobs that they want. They shouldn't be as hard on the men as they are, give the sick men a help. Let a man go home and marry if he wants too.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)

As for conditions after the war, there will certainly be depression as always and the gov. will not (over) live up to hardly any of  their promises especialy[especially] on money, & expect to have some money saved & the rest I will borrow.

The majority of the men in service today only look forward to going back home to the ones that they love and I, for one, intend to do so.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: There must be equal opportunities for Negroes after the war or else there will likely be a bloody revolt. In teaching white & negro  students and associations with fellow teachers, I have noticed all people reared in the same environment with the same amount of education, react the same.  A man's morale is severely lowered if he feels that he has two strikes, so to speak against him, when he is in the army or anywhere else.  Negroes are a part of the earliest American settlers. Yet immigrants came here and got good jobs because of supposedly racial superiority.  America should be for Americans first.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: In the army I am told that there is no discrimination. But I have personally found that discrimination and segregation are both rampant. We are supposted to be fighting for democracy, but I have found that democracy is not practised at home. Officers in many instances are responsible for many sets of prejudices which lead to discrimination and segregation. Lynchings and other brutal acts are perpetrated against members of the armed forces of the U.S., and these acts seem to go unnoticed. Why? Is it because they are carried out on members of a minority group? If these acts continue, and no effort is made to stop them, how can we set an example for the world to follow?Let us as an "ideal" nation stamp out the things tshat are rendering us apart and build a country that is truly "ideal" in every sense of the word.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: As to my chances after the war I feel that there should be greater advantages in some respects. I do feel, that the U.S. could practice more democracy at home than going on foreign territories to stress such policies. Are we absolute sure we are defending what should exist. Here in the army where men or men and democracy is democracy do we have segregation. I feel that those liberal mind leaders of our country could enforce said policies and see that they are carried out. It is an established fact that a revolt is in the making because of such narrow minded men as we have here in America. Why are people so afraid of minority races getting ahead? Can it be shear ignorance as is it the fact they will not be able to compete? I also feel the matter of selection of leaders in the Army have be entirely to much politics and prejudice and not on merit basis.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I sincerely hope that this will be a better place for all of us to live in after the war - a democracy on justice and a equal opportunity for all regardless of race color or creed. This will be the only answer to the cause that we are now fighting for.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: Well firstly as I wrote on page 19 - question 79. I fail to see why I had to be drafted or have any dealings with it. We must stop segregation & give every one a fair play regardless of creed.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: Race Relations - "I intend to be active, either full or part time, in the introduction of feature Motion Pictures with a majority of Negro Performers."
