Conditions after the war will be the same, white people have all the rights, best of places to go, and they just go on thinking we are nothing, yet we were all fighting for them as well as our selves.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I think we as a group have been doing fairly well during this war but there are still many conditions that exist that are rather more  . Eventually they are going to erupt which will hurt many. There are also problems that we can't deal with and to appease higher authority does not help matters any.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I think the Army has done a great injustice to men who are not physically fit for army life, and will suffer the rest of my life from my term in the Army because it has made my physical defects much worse then they were.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I think conditions will be pretty good for about 2 1/2 years after the war, the another chaos will follow as it did in World War I.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: If I am fighting for Democracy here and abroad, I would like to see a little more of it demonstrated in the infantry.  Bullets draw no color line.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I hope that there will be less racial intolerance and less discrimination and more and better opportunities for negroes in all sections of this country  world.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: Will the minority groups of America have the courage we are fighting for; Told the poor Dutch Czech and French that we will liberate yet

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: Well I think the army does not give all of the races equality - for the simple reason I think all servicemen ought to be given a chance to do what they are best fitted for and not only that but to give them a little chance to get ahead. As it is a lot of servicemen come into the army and [insertion] now, do [/insertion]  not know any more than they did before they entered. And after the war those [insertion] that [/insertion] did not get a chance, and if jobs are not at all frequent, the service man or woman will have a hard way to go. So I think a service man or woman should be given the opportunity to learn something that will best  after this crisis - After all people are looking to the future and not at the present or past.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I dont like the camp I am in now.  I am too far away from home and can't see my family as often as I wish to.  I worry most of the time about home and my family.  I don't think things are going as they should be at home.  I think I could benefit the army while taking training nearer home because every time they give a class I only think about home and I never can get what they are trying to learn me on my mind, for thinking about home.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I am a colored person and I am quite sure that if something isn't done about our racial problems now that there is going to be a lot of trouble after this conflict is all over. The colored boys who come back from overseas, who has bled and seen there pals die beside them, aren't going to let themselves be pushed around the way they have been. We expect to come back to someplace where we will be welcomed, not only by out own people but by everyone, we expect to be able to get whatever position we are able to do and unless this is so there will be plenty trouble right here at home.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I think things are being  learned  all right and hope that things will be better for me after the war.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: "I think when men have be [been] in the army 3 year after the war stard [started] should be able to get out if they have a wife and child around.  I am shure [sure] there are enought[enough] to take they place and they do need a rest and are need at home badly.   In three years a man should have done about he can do or more  and he get fed up with the army after so long.   Just ask a man who  came in three years and 6 months ago.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I spent just about two year of my life in here and think the government did their part. I think I should get as much  any member of the arm force although I put all I had in the army I could put and do. I  seene  23 month for the war although I am a private.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I'd like to get out of the army with my parents and relatives. I hope conditions will be better when I get out than they were when I came into the army.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I think that since colored soldiers have played their parts so well in this war that they should be given a better chance to live like any body else after the war. They should be given a fair chance, we can leave the better off. I hope that when we soldiers get out of the Army that we will be able to get jobs as we were promised before we came in.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I think every thing will be very good after the war.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: After the war I would like to see teh negro soldiers get the same  opportunitys that any other solider gets in the United States post war plans.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I dont like race practice because I think a man is a man any were he go and that should be stopped. As for a I am concern the Army is allright but some Soldier dont get there chance the shows what they now like others. I would like to see peace time very soon so married man could go back to there wives and children

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I would like to know why men the 930th F.A., 931th F.A. and 795th T.D. were do away after two year training - the outfit was submit where each all color units - to my opinion and many other of the white race - were ready for combat duty - and with out notice.  The men of the outfits above was ship out to other  Army - and many place they were not need - few are  of many men of the outfit who have been on this for over .If you can answer this question in some way - that I can hear or read myself, I will thank you.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I would like to take up some trade in the army. Would help me when this war is over I won't have to study a trade I will already know one.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I think that definite plans for the wounded to be cared for after the war should be without fault or ordinary criticism.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: Like many others, I was taken from a place of life which I aid others through and were sure would give me a good lively hand. I only hope that the government will give assistance in helping me source a new fast hand on this some trend of life. I am sure it will deem me profitable in Post-war life.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I want to no [know] if we are going to  get  a  loan.  to start the  solider  [soldier] of [off] after the war. you see I want a business of my  own  : So I will need a start:  so  do the  solider  [soldier] get the chance he want when he gets out.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I am also very interested in the progress of the Negro race that should be made after the war. I say that because I feel that the "Negro" will want more than "He" did before the war. I speak mainly as an individual on this subject and not as a incompetent group. The segregation of people in different parts of the country has been the cause of my "Jim Crow" practices. As an "American" I feel that segregation should be suppressed as much as possible, and the "Four Freedoms" granted to every American despite race, color, or creed.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: All I can is this as for the Army its alright in its way and for some fellows but I still think there's room for more colored officers,  , skilled workers, pilots and a whole lot of other material matter that the Army  overlooks  . As for the war I can't comment too much on that because of the simple reason is I haven't followed it that closely but I do hope it ends soon. Conditions in the States after the war  I hope will be better because if they aren't especially for the colored soldier all I can say that it will put an awful black mark on the  banner  of Democracy (if you want to call it that).

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: My face is black and until recently, it has always been my sincere opinion that where ever a black face goes, injustice follows in hot pursuit. The event of the war and the gathering of men - both black and white - together in a sense teaches them the importance of unity within a nation. In my opinion America is not a wholly democratic nation because: there can be no truly democratic nation until every individual within the government of that nation speak, thinks, and actually lives all the ideas expounded by democracy. Though my race of people are not allowed to enjoy all the conveniences of democracy they at least have a chance to fight for that right. Nothing easily won can be greatly appreciated. This war has shown the Negro just what he can do and in years following I say that America shall be the more perfect union.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: Is the white race condemned for what a minority of group does? No! As for the Negro's the whole race is condemned for what a few many do. Emphasis on forcing everyone to go to school from childhood would help solve various questions & solutions as Europe has solved theirs of each citizen as a part of their country - regardless of color, creed, Race, etc. Build highways, clean up slum districts with rent applied to the individuals possible income. Beautify the the surroundings for healthful children of today and tomorrow - Recreation to keep minds & bodies sound!! - For Everyone, Equal rights of a Negro Soldier on trains, buses, eating places, whereas wearing the U.S. uniform means to treat a Negro like a dog - German soldiers are fed better with more priviledges than we are! Why? A person wearing the U. S. uniform is representing his country! Do are children have to continue tomorrow to suffer for their color, I wonder - This is our country too as Negro's, & want to feel as proud as the next one - how can I. Our furture seemly is now more important than ever before. The way one is treated.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: Why is it that they are always  the negros for something that they done or have done and they never  condies  the white. Why is it that the white soldiers can eat cafe and dont have to go to the back and the negros have to go around to the back. I thought that we were all members of the United State army it does seem that way to me  the  Japs and Germans  prisoners   can  go to the front of a cafe and eat and the negros have to go around to the back door or window. an trans  things the Germany  go around with out any guardes but when a negro get put in the guard house when ever he goes any where he has to be guarded I don't think tht right do you.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: It will be a bargaining basis. Those who were promised positions might get them. If the soldiers cannot get positions, I trust they will act like Americans regardless of color or creed for they have been accustomed to violence. If the colored man should be allowed to do more fighting, instead of laboring as engineers and laboring battalions, they will build up a prestige towards themselves that will make far better understanding between the races of mankind when the boys come home. There are many in the Gov't. now discouraging such a civilized gesture; however, I trust that these men are in the minority for they will be the obstacle to understanding and democracy and may further aggravate the friction of racial misunderstanding.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: It  understanding to me which I have seen or do know that Guy R of white people get a grace more than the colored race. Why we are  to the fighting for freedom I have noticed that  do not work on Sundays or nights or a soldier each day of the week, no break at all. Why or what  this is still supported of the war time.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I hope the O. P. A. will keep power within reasons, so that an ex-serviceman won't go broke when buying his civilian needs.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I would like to see a better world in which the negro has to  buy  better living conditions better jobs better education better  and  .

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: The only thing I have to say is that I hope the government will promise and do is find some kind of job for the men after they have been at war this discharged. Personal + thing that sucks your that have been is the service of the U.S. for a deal of time should get the best when even they are dismiss from the Army. A lot of men have married since they been in the army and have wife and family and don't have any home so I do believed it is the government duty to see that every man that has served in the U.S army is titled to a good farm

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I think all mens in the service after the war should be paid for there time spent in the Army and they should be first in getting jobs. And I also think all the peoples should work as a team. And the Government should take care of the mens that have lost there health the rest of there times.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I would like to say that if it wasn't so much race prejudices in the Southern States we as a whole could do better. My father on [insertion] owns [/insertion] a small farm but never get the chance to get the price an sell his goods as the whites. There are a large number of Negros in the south who haven't had the chance to get an education . and good jobs due to their color and is as good in the fields and have always as a whole been low in salary compared to the job. Also in the Army we to stay out of certain px's and never gets the privileges we should get due to our color.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: Regimentation while in the Army is necessary but in a program of rehabilitation both physically and economically the should be dispensed with as much as possible for a lot of us the change from things military to civilian will be deffienct therefore humanitarisism based on a sound and workable economic scale should be employed.A great number of enlisted men are wondering if the benefits administration to veterans will be done on a basis of equality. If not, then the whole setup will be futile from the beginning. Personally speaking I will not accept secondary citizenship or remuneration in lieu of services rendered. This is my country. I want all she has to offer, no more no less.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: What I am about to say is about the condition of the United States is about the way the white and Negroes get along in some sections of the states and they are suppose to be fighting for the same thing. Democracy the United States talk about fight Democracy in Europe and Asia and yet they haven't established it in the states in some sections. The race riot in Penn. happened because the railway company hired six negroes the white walk off the job this kind of stuff have got to be stopped after the war so the United States might have another civil war on her hand the negroes are dying and fight in this war to. You hear about the white troop in newspaper and over the radio but you never hear about the colored soldiers that fight and die. You don't hear about the 93rd division and  inf in Bouganvill fighting and dying no where but in a Negro newspaper but all that will come to light some day.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I haven't any comments to say what so ever on conditions in the United States after the war only one thing concerning segregation. It seems war doesn't have any pick on any particular nationality. We are all in this thing together and we must finish it together. ( ) Race roits in  Ohis  , California, and Penn. Wars cannot be won that way be-cause one color refuses to work in the same building with the other.  What I'm really trying to say is that after this war is over, I hope the city  pors  of this country will try to have more respect towards one and another. If they do they will find that this will be a better country to live in.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I think the morale of men in the service would be much better if they could get furloughs as often as every six to eight months and be given passes when  and if you're not actually need [needed] around camp. The worst thing I've encountered since I've been in the army was seeing men  be turned down for a pass after working hard all week. I hope and pray that the Army feed [feeds] the men who stay in the army after the war better than they're being fed here on this post now in time of war.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I think after the war if working conditions are too hard that they should take the person who can't not find work or would not work. I also think if a man have had over a year or more training within or out of the United States He or she should go back home + live. A study of army training in school would be fine also.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I sincerely hope and trust that the war and the results of it will open the hearts and minds of all people to a sense of wright and wrong, to equality and fair play. That such a job will never be necessary again for the rest of eternity. That we as a nation straighten out our own problems just a little faster. That the groups within our fair nation may see and take in this fair land the United States.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: Can only hope that there is total peace,  universially  , and more so domestically. That this war would be beneficial so far as Races are concerned. To stamp racial discrimination and prejudice from the soil which advocates "that all men are created equal."  There is only one superiority and maybe a possible two. That is mental superiority and physical superiority.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: What I have to say concerning the army probably is a common policy in the army but I don't think it is a very good one. Our Regiment had about two thirds of the men transferred out to go overseas sometime in the near future. The other remaining third stays here for how long we don't know, but these men soldiered together for over three years, most of them were dam good soldiers. It was pitiful to see grown men crying at being separated from their buddies; maybe never to see them again. Why wouldn't they send the whole Regiment? The Division to which they went still isn't up to strength with infantry men and they're getting them from somewhere else, instead of taking us. The new men we have now, if we go overseas will never work like the gun crews our buddies made. The rest of the fellows feel the same way as I.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: Yes, "Housing" I think there should be more low rent apartments, "what I call W.P.A. shacks" for the majority of homes. I've seen the average citizen live in are more of less unfit for a human being to live in. Project Houses are clean roomy, healthier , makes a more compact community, affords children, facilities, enabling them to keep off the streets, thus helping keep down crime.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I think the Soldiers in the different camps should be given more  Christatism  lessons because orientation is a subject that plants a soldiers far the past, present, future it has him alived to the different question the arise from day to day and it keep him confronted with the war situation from day to day and it has an Education program that every soldier should know something, about, that he can carry on his education after the war and there government use losn in money to formd his education. It also has a program where you can study you enemies & know you allies and it give you weapons a Ideals to camp on in the form of all ads.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: To avoid needless riots and melee's between the races, the government should become quite harsh in dealing with people or firms or business etc, who are responsible, by their discrimination and prejudice, for causing friction between Negroes and Whites. If the U.S. government continues to be lax in enforcing and carrying out strident laws on these matters, in the post war period with thousands of men home hardened by being under fire and adept in the art of killing, race riots of a much higher frequency and carnage than any heretofore, will certainly ensue. The Negro men who have been fighting and dying for this supposedly Democracy, will not tolerate conditions as prior to this global War. [underline] Take heed Uncle Sam. [/underline]

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I think that the Army has wasted untold sums of money, By training a soilder to do one thing. And then let his talent go wasted. Hav any other men on the jobs somtime not even fit, They should give exams . Like the navy. The men best fitted for the jobs are the ones that derived the benefits

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I think the Army has given the Negro a very bad break. First by the they stand by and let and let the Germans of the south lynch and murder our boys and they dont  get  anything it. They have  hareing giving our people a chance or hand the reconzied has as man  .  If I should get of this Army never no more for me.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: For the use that the negro troops have been used for as I see it they could have just as well been left out of the army all together. Men are just shifted around from place to place with the apparent intention of denying them their just dues. After the war I feel as though things will be in a bad fix financially as well as morally. With men being away from their homes for such long periods of time. It has been 10 mos. since I have been home, it is natural to look for a large percentage of broken homes.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: Conditions after the war for the negroes should be a prosperous one due to the fact that during the war Negroes have taken advantage of every chance and opportunity they have had given them.Never before in the history of America has Negroes played such an important part as they have now for instance, when have we before had Aviation Squadrons, paratroopers and as many officers as we do now.  The time to strike is now and the continuation of such should be gradual with each generation showing advancement instead of retogression.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: The army ruined pratactical every negro boy my age life unnecessarily. They took us out of school and brought us into the army under the same regulation that the white boy but still we were denied nearly everything that we could use after the war. Our morale has and always will be low because we cannot see why we were drafted to served our country yet the opportunity was refused us. Since I have been in the army I have been treated as bad as a dog by the white man while our enemy German, Italians, are treated like a king before my eyes. When I get back into civilian life, my problems will be to come to a finaly stage with the "southern white" man. My race has profit somewhat by this war, they have been trained to protect themselves and use modern weapons.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: All I have to say is that I would like to see some of the good that the war done and get some of the things we are fighting for and give every man equal rights as far as possible.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I don't like this  war Army now  if things are as bad after the  war  as they are now this place will have another war on there hand providing all the Colored stick together and keep  punching  if  not  a colored man will see a  hellish  way to go in fact he is doing that now.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I think things after the war will be  fair conditions ten years after and then after may be some change made under certain conditions.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I think the United States is doing a might important part in the 2nd World War expecially for the other country, Iknow she is doing the part for herself. I know the condition of the United States will be much better after the war.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I don't have any thing to say about the war But that  I Been I have not seen it said be  yet I'd have had a fine army life up to now. I do think I had a fine time to express my feeling about the army and to get your no How. I  felt about it and  what I was doing in the army. I hope it will be soon over and I can get started on my plans as I say -

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: The only thing that I have to say is I wonder will the Negro as a whole will be treated any better? I have been station in the south every since I enter the army and it still remains the same. Cant there be some condition set ups to better the Negro conditions? Cant they be treated as men? Will they be treated as every other man? Men have many thoughts, when they no [know] that all of us are created equal, and there is  difference  in the treating of  men  .

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I do which [wish] that some of this discrimination was broken up in the U.S. because we all have givening [given] so much to keep it down but yet it still come up.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I wish that down South that the white peoples would stop running over the colored peoples. we should not have it in the United States at all Discrimination what I mean

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: This being  the army of the most ideal democracy known, and fighting for freedom + equality, should know no impartiallity, yet it seems to me that is fosters the condition.  If this cannot be corrected in the army, how can it be in civilian life??

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I feel that we should not change  our  President until the war is  over  then  other men  should be given a  chance   to   show  their abilities. We just can't take that sort of  at this time. Up to now things  r  aparently going o.k.  under  the  present    I also feel that men with the abilities to do certain  comfort or support  jobs to help the war are not  given the  chance to do so.  I also feel that  in France and Italy should be turned into  arsenals  to manufacture  equipment.  And that all our war equipment should be  returned  to America after the war.  because   might eventually find these same materials used by some body against us. and  all  war with Russia. See to it that service men qualify for jobs  gets   them  after this war.  encourage men to remainin the army by raising Army pay and getting  the  kind of jobs  they   so as to each employment  after war. [written along the left vertical edge of the page in two columns] [first column] P.f.c.  Roy or Ray  Francis - 4205329 7  -co.  c or e  372nd Inf. - Camp  Breckinridge  KY [underlined] 31-8-44. [/underlined] [second column] I would like to volunteer   in or on  the merchant marine service if I could. [underlined] R. F. [/underlined]

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I wish and hope the Army will let me go in Six months after the war like I was promised.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I believe things after the war in the Untied States  will be better for at least 5 or 10 years how it will be after that I dont really know. I have asked people whom I thought knew. They say there will be hard times a lot of newspapers say the same thing but I think they are wrong. I have more faith in this country than that but maybe I am an optimist I always have been I always hope and think for the best. The reason I chose working as a  bucker  in the woods or as a lumber piler because I believe I can become a good man at either job and I dont have a good enough schooling for a government job or [insertion] think [/insertion] that I would like indoor work I also think that certain jobs should be opened to negros that unless you think we do them too well

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: The war although sometimes termed as bloody should bring men closer together. We should realize that a man is a man, rights opportunities and priveleges should be shared by all.  After the war we can't afford to shut ourselves off in a closet and say  taboo  to the world, but we must help the weakest ones to see the right side of life.  It is my belief that we all should have profitted by the war. I am more of a man than I was four years ago. I can do most any thing better than I could four years ago. May it come a time when all the world will wake up. I think its about time.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: The Army should put a man where he is best fitted and do the most good

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I have been in the army about a year now and I am getting pretty tired of it. They should get some of the civilians who are walking the streets not doing anything and put them in the army. I think conditions will be maybe worst after the war because like after the last war their might be another depression until probably a lot of men will be then out of work because there would be a great need for so many defense plants.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: After the way I am almost sure that we will do many things that use  before and these things will most likely be of an importance to our nation because this war being the worse one in all history, has been a lesson for the most of us.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I would like to say this all services men should get some kind of break after this war and also some kind of money to get him started. Cause most of them wont have much if they are like me which most of them are. And the Army should give us more furloughs and passes to keep up the moral of a soldier.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: The army should consider and treat all soldiers as soldiers of he U.S. Give all the same treatment and fair play that they talk about but, which we soldiers here seldom see. Instead of trying to give freedom to the world, why not just start here in the U.S. give freedom here completely and unconditionally to all living under its fear. It's hard to be in uniform hearing about the fight to free some people thousands of miles away when here is where the fight for freedom should be fought.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I think that a soldier should have priority in most everything so far as jobs are concerned. Because they will help mostly to bring freedoms to this nation and  [insertion] we [/insertion] have gone through many hardships that most of the public will never know and don't realize.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: First of all I think they should let the men out of service first who have served in the army before Pearl Harbor. Being in the army four and five years really works on a young man's mind. I should think after spending the best part of his life in the army he should be entitled to at least have the remaining part of his life in ease and comfort. I suppose married men think they should be the first ones out but most of the young do have parents waiting for them and their just as important as any wife. Hearing single men talk on this subject they all seem to agree with the statements made. I am counting on this so don't fail me.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I'm liking that conditions for a soldier after the war won't be against him, By that I mean he will be able to find work with wages favorable to him. May the country's (?) war conditions be dealt with before the soldier is returned to civilian life and may the government give the soldier the best assistance it can afford.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: If I may ask anyone   of the people who got together to make this book - What is the so said difference in Black + White - Over the great pond on the other side there no difference in that or at that front line - Why should and Soldier in the USA have to with stand the things that are place in front of him causing him to look at things of life with a douptful [sic] look in his eyes - I think that this Gov for the people + by the people should work out something that might change the minds of some of the people found here in the south - And help stop all of the foolishness  I believe a man is a man unless he is proven different and the Army has proven that to be

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I don't believe that conditions in the U.S. will be any better after the war for the colored man because we still have that race prejudice here more than ever. Colored soldiers have died on foreign soil and those that come back will not want to be faced with the same conditions that they left. The South is the South and it will take more than a pen or a pencil to change it. Some of those men coming back are not going to take the insults that they had to swallow before and it will only end in bloodshed. I hope that after this is over something is done to clean up our own home so that we may all live as one great big family. A man is a man, black or white and he should be treated as an equal no matter where he may happen to be, North or South.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I don't think that the army is giving the colored soldier a fair chance. Most of the colored soldiers are put in the quarter masters, engineers or some other labour organization. Most of them that I've seen [insertion] or heard [/insertion] about has been taught to dig ditches and drive tanks. One can't very well plan on a future doing that kind of work. There is some talk about training them for better jobs after the war, but I think that if it isn't done now, it wont be any too successful after the war.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I think the conditions in the United States will be better after the war.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: Well I think after the war the arm force should dictate about what should be done. In other words the servicemen should get a square deal in everything, such as good jobs and etc.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I am a negro. That might be enough for those concerned but I must say that a negro in the U.S. Army have a tougher time than an ordinary prisoner of war. I have three younger brothers overseas and it burns me up when I go out and the same people tell me that I can't go certain places and seeing signs that say Colored & White me with three brothers fighting overseas for these same people. I've seen this time when I couldn't get anything to eat while on pass because the Colored Restaurant was closed  & I couldn't go into the so called white restaurant. I also seen fellows come back from pass late because they had to wait until all the white people were taken care of. I don't have to tell you this  you know it, and my brothers fighting for Democracy & Freedom and Peace Equal Rights Define those things

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I would like to say that I think the army is doing a great job but I'm sure that I could be of more service to it in my branch of service, one where I know and like.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I think that the U.S. should [underscore] not [underscore] wait until 6 months after to discharge the married men with children. I think that they should be the first man to get discharged. I also feel that a man with a wife and children at home and who has not served overseas should [underscore] not [underscore] be sent across with the army of occupation. Men with families at home are out on the battlefield today fighting to end this war so that they may return to their families as soon as possible. Single men usually have very little responsibility other than taking care of themselves. Married men have a wife and possibly children to raise and provide for. I have not heard yet of a measure yet to release the married men first or one prohibiting their being sent overseas as an army of occupation. Married men want to get home as soon as possible. Why keep them any longer than necessary?

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I would like to get out of the army and go back to New York and Buy a home. I think after the war things will be better and the Colored people will have a better chance this time than before. I will like to move out of the united States to some south American town. I think I will live better there than I do in the States. I just cant get along with some of the white people in the South that is why I left there. I said that I will never go back to the south again but I was induct in to the Army.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I think after the war that all of the off rased, forces should be given the same chances at everything, especially, according to the Individual capabilities. The war has brought about some of these changes, and they should be increasing steadily, and when we all get back home again things will look as if there has been a gret change and we can all see what we have fighting for.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I'm stationed Ky. The Jim Crow-ism here is terrible. Why is the colored man treated the way he is?

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: The U.S. army is OK, as far as I am concerned, but it dont do one fare [fair] justice. I am better qualified of doing something else than what I am now doing[,] the army dont give one a chance to do what he do know. The U.S. army is not fare [fair] to a col. [colored] soldier in the south, they are not treated as the white.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I look forward to discrimination being abolished.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I don't like the way that civilians are [striking/unclear] and delaying the out put of much needed war materials which are needed in all fighting fronts. And also the segregation which they have back here in the States in the [A rmy/unclear] where we were getting along like brothers on the fighting front.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: There are lots of men in the ARmy who are not given a chance to exercise their abilities because of the lack of education of their leaders. If given a chance these men could really be a great benefit and help to both their country and the principles of this whole universe.  I think officers and non-coms should be higher educated so they could understand and give the men below them a chance to show their abilities instead of grumbling and hollering at them all the time.  Most non-commissioned officers knows not and knows not that they know not.  Thank you.  X

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85) [cont.] A continuation page
q85: It is the opinion of some, that colored soldiers are treated better now than in any other war in United States history. If they were treated more unfairly then they are now, in the past it is a wonder they were not compelled by force of arms to jail. The U.S. Army for a country that preaches to such a great extent about democracy, it would seem they would look at the military history of the colored race, as regards U.S. wars, since the beginning &, who have served faithfully all along & are denied so much. The prayers of the race is not to be heralded, not be gloried, until full equality is reached, especially through education, political & social. They have as much brains & more character than a great many other American nationalities, yet so completely handicapped by dictatorial laws; which are against  God and our country. What you extend to them after this war will greatly shape the situation. No one has yet taken the full responsibility or energetically attempted to fully solve this problem which will sooner or later (if it is not solved) give this country a blot on its visibly great record. There are more negroes in this country than there are Canadians in the whole of Canada; they are a nation within themselves; and are not even given the chance to heartily support this country as they would so which. It is not just a southerner's blame, but the entire country's shame; those who let it continue and only act as commentators are even more to blame than Rep. [Representative] Bilbo of Missippi [Mississippi] and his  birmen  . I am indeed ashame, unto God for being such a weak man and having to take; all this

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85) [cont.] A continuation page
q85: I really understand why every man doesn't get his chance in the army. That is because the army doesn't take them unless they are mentally qualified and secondly we have just experienced this huge army for the first time in history. Therefore we or I expect  mistakes but as a whole it is being handled very fair & the best of military and ability. And I am for at least one year's training for young men after the war, and they can be corrected by the mistakes made in the past years of them or this present war. Because I personally believed & have study history which shows, we & the world to have one just about every 20 years. Therefore I will be old then & won't have to do what my parents are doing today. Let the Army take care of the next war but pray we don't have one. Jesse C. Gibson 33638911

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I think I feel like other hundreds   of my race in the armed forces that we will be denied equal rights to the four freedoms. After having found segregation in the armed forces along with discrimination, I am sure I was not justified in being called to fight for something I had been denied all my life. I had reached the conclusion that the Bill of Rights is practically a farce because it has been used  shamlly  & unscrupiously by the high rulers of the U.S.A.  I also feel that blood will be spilled & lives lost after this war, within this country because of men being refused the rights they fought for in the present conflict. I for one feel that there are principles & rights I would feel proud to die for knowing that the ancestors of my race & time profited by my death & its cause. I believe that my race has awakened & fully realize that something worth fighting for is worth having. We have learned to fight the intelligent way & what we should fight for. We realize there is strength in intelligence, ambition, faith & self confidence.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: There are a lot of men being transferred to combat troop that are physically unfit for field duty. These men are griping and that tends to lower morale in all units. There is also at some camp, a good deal of Sec[tion] VIII discharges that are being given to soldiers wrongfully. Not deserving a Sec[tion] VIII, these men are planning to fight any effort on draft after the war. A man injured in the service (not in combat) and in the line of duty should be given some consideration.  As a whole, the Army is really a fine, modern place. I like it. I think every man should be required to take some  after the war - and most unemployed should be drafted for a 1 year period with one month off every quarter.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I think after the war the United States will be a happy place to live in.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: Being the minority group (racial) I can't help but bitch about the , shall I say "undemocratic" priviliges the army and for that matter the United States as a whole has towards the Negro troop. Its no wonder at all that the morale of the colored soldier is at low tide. A man will never put all is strength out to save a burning house if he knows he won't be allowed in the house when the fire is out. I often wonder who is doing more to win the war - The Negro soldier who fights and dies for his country, or Senator Bilby who fills the Congressional Records with ways and means to keep this soldier from bettering himself and his children.  Among the postwar plans that the  Parre  and his staff ha been making I still haven't read any concerning the Negro when he returns from the war.  [Verbiage "Note" [underline] is written in the left margin next to the paragraph starting, "Among the postwar plans..."] "A man who is willing to fight and die for his country deserves a equal deal from that country"  -Theo. Roosevelt

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: How am I to be sure that I or any service man will benefit from the G.I. Bill and other such bills? What insurance have I that the government will actually fulfill to promises? What government have I that the government will back up these bills and insure that every single man benefits from them? What about discrimination and prejudice, when is the government going take  amplantion after to ware  such degrading practices? Business have no discrimination against color and Russia is a Communist country. She are on the endowed justices and punishes everyone who violates that law. Democracy means equality for all. When is American really going to be Democratic? All the G.I. units and  within its own confidential limits what  claim she is fighting for abroad - is it any wonder that I and others of my race  desitetes  in offering our lives in behalf of our country.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: My home [insertion] is [/insertion] in Alabama as stated. I have live the largest part of my 26 yrs there. The place is rotten you don't know wheather you are fighting for the lily white Alabamans or against them. Why I say that is because of the fact that the Germans P.W. are treated better than the United Nations Colored Soldiers. You walk through the streets in fear of being shot, insulted, locked up in the jails by the White policeman. We want to come out of the wars feeling like we have fought for our Country. And to some our people regardless of race creed color. And men like Dixon Bilbo, O'Connely, Lombadge, should never ben in any position where he can have any thing to say about the Negro and his welfare.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: The an a white man war and I do not think that the negroes have been given a chance to prove what they can do. I think that each race of people school be given a chance to prove what they can do before it can be said what one cannot do.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I sincerely believe that the government waste a lot of time + money by keeping men who are physically fit on the side when they could be made useful overseas.  [This topic is separate] The  soldiers  with my outfit for over 3 years ad just recently the war department as some of the  Higher ups decided to break the  up to use it as a replacement. We were  often  in Fort  for a long time. Then from there down to this [underline]  damn  [/underline] Camp   Ky  Right in the Heart of the  Peaks  +  Crackers  . Frankly speaking I don't see any point in any colored people being in any branch of the service. When you have such leaders as Senator  of Missouri. I've talked with quite a few fellows and they are of the same opinion. As long as you have men in office like  ex.  Governor Talmadge of  Georgia  + the rest like him. how the hell do you  or  anyone expect to  have  any kind of morale amongst the  negro   soldiers  . They are dying everyday and for what. You tell me. I think it is a damn shame. I think that  Balboa  + the rest of his breed should be impeached from office.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I would be very glad when the war is over so I can go home and I hope that every man will have his own  writes

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I would like to see the day that negros are given the same chance that the white are given in the South, after all we are fighting for the same thing. Also a right to attend some of the same school and a right to suggest things that will benefit the Country and not a race. In the South you don't have that. I remember once someone suggest that negros to attend the University of Ga. What did the  say, no.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I can not understand as a soldier in the United States army am fighting for the same reasons why there  so much segregation on  army posts or camp. It seems to me that a soldier should be respected anywhere anytime regardless of his color or race. It more or less making our problems harder right here in the United Staes than it is in foreign countries. Until such time as the other people realize the fact that we are humans and not animals as some of them treat us like then  for every one will be better. It's  certainly  plenty of space for everyone   it all seems up to who is the American + who is not. But I  guess  it too great for me. But I hope to ask some one clear it up soon. Sometime in the near future

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I hope after the war think will be better at home than before I am planning on a great success after the ware I am inrened to be success after the war I want to be a ship bilder. try not I want to buy a big caner ranch and big porter form part of the big nurnely of all help I can but a going on an and I want to be pornpan I got give adeas and I hope they work. I am all be an thing about the funny and am looking forward

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I think there should be Colored officer in every colored outfit, as there enough men that are qualified, as well as more colored combat outfits. Also the government should do something about the treatment colored receive in the South, as the moral of the colored soldier is very low That is one reason I can appreciate this Regiment as it is all colored, which make one feel that the colored man is worthwhile. There are quite a large number of colored soldier with high qualifications that aren't being used because there is so much Racial Friction in the army. Untill that is taking out there will always be misunderstanding.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: Since I have been in the army I have been station in camps in  south, and have felt the blows of Jim Crowism, segregation. I have witnessed man outrages imposed on negro soldiers in the South, and it left the average soldier comrade and myself with the attitude of what are we fighting for. I have met and talked with many white soldiers who had never been in the south before the war and had an opportunity to see what was going on. They seemed a bit disturbed about this thing also. Many of them had not realized what Jim Crow really was. I think that this condition is the condition that should be corrected after the war. The United States is a nation of Christians. Christianity begins at home. The main thing is, is our house in order? I think that thousands of soldiers white and black can answer that question. Men like Talmadge of Georgia the governor of Mississippi are not worth the powder to blow [insertion] them [/insertion] to hell. It is a pity that men like them are allowed to do and say the things they want.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: The Government of the United States as head of each department .....complete...Congress has grown to become a large and... law making ...confusing and inconsistent. Advocates as its principal favor to influence unite Government as a

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I feel that every man regardless of [underline] race color [/underline] or [underline] creed [/underline] should share equally in the fruits of the [underline] persuit [/underline] of Democracy. That each man should have a reasonable portion of the necessitee of life. That the United States should start to practis and live up to its Constitution. Finally that [underline] laws [/underline] should [underline] govern [/underline] the people as a whole and not certain groups of people.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I must say that the Army plainly help my Race and it  hand  brought out so many Poor Boys I came and did not see.  I wish I could put my name here so I could write the government concerning of this.  The hold world will be better after the war than before it began I can say it is five of us brothers in the army and I am the baby boy. The army is OK with me. God bless it I pray I will serve my country, The army do help.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: To my opinion, the Negro soldier is not treated in any Post, Camp or station, like he is fighting a war for democracy. Which mean as stated a million of times, Freedom of Speech, all men being created equal, regardless of race, Color or Creed, a right to vote a right to live as a decent man. I have seen soldiers hung and no investigation made. The Negro soldier as I believe is in one Army and then theres the Army. The Army doesn't have discipline now as it once had. These young white officers only molest the Negro soldier to an extent to almost  a social disaster. My own case for instance I volunteered to join the Infantry, and was reduced to the tirade of a Pvt for doing it. As far as AR's & N.O. Circulars in some units the white officers completely overlook them. I've seen it in at least 4 units of QM. This should be ceased. After the war, in my own estimation and listening to the Conversation of men. I think trouble may even leak out. I only hope this get in the hands of the right man, whom can put a stop to this.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I think that the Government should improve the Colored Race and give jobs to the men that can do the work. I think that the government should try to abolish Jim Crow-ism

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I think arrangements should be made to get new jobs after they get out of the army. They should be that every man should have a steady income even if its[sic] small. I have no fault to find with the army at all except they don't treat all men fair. I don't think conditions will be so bad after the [missing word?] I think everybody should stand by each other to win the war as quick as possible.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: Personally I think conditions in the states gonna be hell. I don't think us colored folks getting a fair break is . They ain't treating us fair I caught hell in Ft. Bliss, Texas and the other southern states. We had to live off the post and white folks lived on the post. The next god damned thing I don't like this army.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I know it will be some change. I hope I won't have to live in a southern state because negroes are treated so bad in those states.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: In the state of Georgia Negro soldiers are not treated as men in the towns by both officials and civilians. Soldiers are beaten up without cause by civilian policemen. They are actually hard and brutal to the whole Negro race. They have to ride in the rear in all city busses and coaches. If they are from two to four seats from the rear, they are forced to get up and give their seats to white people. There have been many fights and near riots between soldiers and civilians, especially between bus operators and soldiers who resented this unfair treatment.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I think the United States as a whole will be in a better condition after the war than before. I believe there will be more jobs in circulation than before the war because there is more money in circulation and civilians will probably put it to  better  use in making new jobs.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I think the Negro should be given a square deal in all part of the U.S. I think that poll tax should be abolist each and everybody should have a chance to vote. I do think that the Anton Curzel Bill should be passed. I think that Congress should enforce and pass the equal right Bill. such senators as Bill of Missi and Pegler and Cotton Ed should never be an exictive Officer of the United States. If such Negro haters wasn't in excitive power the people would have a different stage of mind.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I do not think scale troops get a fair break, because after three years in the army he should not have to take Basic [insertion] training [/insertion] over again. If they can't get enough men for the army after the war the reason will be because of the breaks he (Soldiers) got during the war.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I like the state I lived in very much. It is very nice to live in if I could only get more  justice  or a better opportunity to the rights of American citizens.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I think the colored people should have certain rights after the war. After having gone through as much as others. They should get the job they're best qualified for.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I feel that the Negro should have a better break after the war, than what they're have for the simple reason that they can have say so after the war just like the rest of them. Because if they don't get the break they should I think they will get it regardless. I think the Negro in the United States Army should be recognized as good as another nation or better.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I feel as a whole that we are being mistreated by white officers. While we were being transfered [transferred] . We were order [ordered] to pay a cleaning bill with our ration money. While on our way to this camp we had to go without food. I think that is a very poor way to treat men.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: When this war is over I want to forget all about the Army. I don't want any more to do with it."

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: The conditions after the war such be better in many places. If not it may be a chance of some thing happen.  Be in ones  to stop things like that they will have to do better.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: Feel that racial conditions will be worser after the war thats all

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I have no comments to make.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I have nothing to say.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I think Negroes should have a better break than what they get now. They should have a chance at any kind of job if they are qualified to do it. I think the govt. should abolish Jim Crow.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I think conditions will be kind of rough after the war. War is costing a lot o' money. But after 3 or 4 years things should improve. And I hope that as long as there's breath in my body I'll never have to enter nobody's army. After the war I feel there's going to be a lot of race riots but I hope not. I hope we won't have to organize an army to prevent it.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I hope things won't be like as it was in the last war, promise a lot but give nothing. I think Roosevelt should stop the discrimination in the army and else where because he say he can't stop it but he can. I believe if a soldier fight he should be recognized as white soldiers are and like at Camp Livingston Louisiana a damn soldier has a helluva way to go. Discrimination in Louisiana is very bad. One night I was on guard and the Major told me to allow no colored soldier to cross and I think that should have been all soldiers instead of Negro soldiers. If it is left with me I will bomb all parts of the south, Georgia and Kentucky and Mississippi. After this war I hope I won't have to see any more of this lynching going on around here. That is where we are gonna have another army of my own. I planning on having me an army of my own after the war. To ROOSEVELT: I want him to stop all of this unnecessary stuff that is going on around here.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I have been on some post where the white soldiers were shown the most appreciation.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I feel that I was treated right. I have no complaints to make as a whole I am satisfied.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I think that the U.S. can keep a large Post War Army from (unclear) but I still think men reaching a certain age should be drafted and it should be part of every college program (Mil. Tong.)

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I feel that there should be some especially trained workers in the Army that servicman can go to with their most personal problems. I realize that there are chaplains but there should be some other agency. I feel that the men in the service forces and outfits should be given recognition for their efforts as are the combat units. These men do not realize the vital importance of their contribution. They are the "unsung heroes"

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: *47-49 I would like to stay in the Army after the war if I could qualify as an air cadet and successfully complete the training prescribed.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: In settling the peace terms in Europe, I feel that Stalin will have much to say concerning it. Knowing the form of government that exists in Russia and here I feel that there will be a controversy which will result in war between Russia and America.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I believe that much of the oft [often] mentioned serious repercussions that's expected to come after the war can be averted by sensible thinking, and doing, by [underline] all [/underline]  Educate youth from the beginning, [underline] NATION WIDE [/underline]  Physical training in place of compulsory military training.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I think military life is alrite for those who like it. Personally I think conditions in the US will be a lot better than before.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I just don't like to be in the Army.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: The colored people are not getting a chance to do the things they are capable of doing.  The training the colored soldiers get is not necessary, too much drill and not enough technical training.  Colored soldiers should be given a chance to show their ability other than on the field.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I think conditions will be better after the war is over.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: "I don't think that the Negro soldier will get the break that he is promised after the war is over and I don't think that the soldier will get the jobs that he is promised because the jobs that he could do he wont be able to get."

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I think it will be better living after the war and men will know how to take responsibility.  I definitely is going to stay in the Army for a career.  I think that we should have an Army larger than the one we had before.  I would like to serve over sea.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I think things will be worse in the U.S. after the war. I hope the war will end quickly.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I think that there should be a gradual release of men after the war to avoid confusion, as would happen if too many were discharged at one time. It would also give an ex serviceman time to readjust himself.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: The deliberate mistreatment of Colored soldiers in a supposedly democratic army fighting for theoretically democratic principles is one of the wonders of the twentieth century.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: Segregation should be abolished. The Negro race should be given equal + fair chances for all jobs and positions the may qualify for.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: Here, I would like to say, if you haven't a good idea of my views in general, that is concerning the Army, you're just shit out of luck.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I believe the time I've been in the Army has delayed any establishing the way I am to make my living.  I don't believe  mechanics  will do it for me so I'll lose more time getting started when I get out.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: When the war is over, the men whether married or single, with greatest length of service [crossed out word] service, sure be discharge after the fellow from combat

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I would like to say I hope we who are serving will get a descent break and miss the Depression which followed the last war. As a negro I know I will have a very hard time unless the government does something towards helping. The G.I. Bill of rights will be entirely no help to me at all. I have to start from scratch I've no colateral at all to fall back on I'm too old for school.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: Just End the war and let me out I'll do the rest

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I believe that every of - servicemen should be given a good job as soon as he is discharged so that he will be able to see things clear and get on his feet so to speak.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: For one thing there's favoritism of in some cases one gets far from a square deal

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: Future  serviceman should be assured of a job best suited for him. After all, he did take a chance and leave behind all he had and was working for to help rid the world of destruction. He should have something fairly decent too look forward to.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: Why in hell do we Negros have to take our training down in the south. Before being shipped down here I was in far sports about the whole offair. Now I would much rather do my fighting down here in the  sobd  South

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: What I think about conditions in the (South) couldn't be put on paper in fact, each time I go to the city around  post  I feel as if I am not in the United States. I could go on all day, but it don't really do any good, the government dont wish to do anything about conditions down south.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I think the negro race have a better chance after war than before. Because they is  catching  hell now.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: The Army need a complete change over all in the U.S. All crashers need to be killed and a new Generation taught the meaning of [underline] DEMOCRACY [/underline]  The Army is to dam  Chirsted  . How in the Hell do you think I want to fight the Japs for a country that wont allow me to build where I want to or eat when I'm hungry. This is my first time South and I ran what this country need is the Head of People like Billo, Sporken, Colten Ed Smith and their likes  A civil war wont hurt a dam Bit.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I am a Colored Soldier and Can't see why in all Hell they keep us down here with these narrow minded folks. We are treated worse than dogs. Yet the army expects us to practice Military Courtesy where ever we go. Why make us fight against the enemy of foreign soil when they fight against us? I am a citizen of the U.S. and am willing to fight the enemy. I love the flag and what it stands for. But I am forced to ask again. Why does the Southern White man fight us. Can't Washington do anything about it? We are drafted - sent to the Battlefields, yet Can't do a small thing like ride on a Bus or eat at a lunch Counter. Explain to me and I will be satisfied.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: Personally I am interested in a discharge. When I was ambitious and wanted to good good for the country. I was handled and kept down in the ranks until I became discouraged and felt that it was to no avail.  Not that I have no ambition I would be better off for myself first and for the other fellows in service if I was not among them.  I sherk revellie and all other formations. There are some things like revellie and retreat that are only a waste of time some thing to irk a man. Getting up at five oclock and getting to sleep at eleven is too much.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I personally don't feel as though I have a right to fight for the army that is below Washington. I've seen some pretty nasty tricks pull by the southern  white man I accually seen col. officers beat up and insulted by southern white M.P.s And if [insertion] our [/insertion] col. soldiers aren't respected enough in a U.S.A. uniform, then  [insertion] we are not [/insertion] qualified to die on forieng shores.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: On a whole the Army has done a great deal for a number of people, but I feel personally that I've forgotten + lost  time  for the number of months I've been in here. document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: Directly after the war I don't think conditions will be so bad, but a few years later there may be another depression.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I HOPE THE DEMOCRACTIC WARS WHICH I HAVE BEEN TAUGHT TO BELIEVE IN WILL BE MORE PROMINENT

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I believe those men who enlisted, voluntarily at any time before or during the war, should be the first to be offered discharges.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: If things aren't any different after the war for negros there won't be any peace for me. I'm determined to have what I'm entitled to, and I'd fight Americans as quick as Japs to get it. I can't understand why we refere to Germans and Japs as Cruel and barbarians when we're seeing the same thing daily at our doorsteps. Surely America doesn't expect the negro soldier to come back and like the treatment he received before leaving. I personally think the politicians here are a bunch of yellowbellies who haven't guts enough to back a good constitution.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: If conditions aren't any better for the negro race after the war than they are now I'm afraid the peace in the U.S. will be very short. I thinks it's a national disgrace that negroes must shed their blood for privileges which they never receive.  I think social conditions in the United States are deplorable + what makes if all the more disgraceful is the fact that all the Jim Crowism seems to originate from the capitol of the U.S.  The constitution of the United States means absolutely nothing where the negro is concerned. The so called great congress of the U.S.is doing nothing what so ever to better the unbearable conditions.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: Something has to be done about the treatment of minority groups doing this war and also in the postwar world.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: It is my contention that according to the Constitution of this Country all men were & are created equal, yet we have segregation isolation, & discrimination of the Negro whether he is giving his life as a soldier working in a defense plant as a civilian  being ing  war hands etc. However this problem that confronts each day here is the South daily will eventually and rapidly reach to inevitable  chior  or catroshpe [catastrophe] that it is now leading toward. It has been my pleasure to live where there was so little of the aforementioned grieviances that I never cam in contact with it  It is my contention also that the easiest way to disrupt the type of life among refferal to as were the American way is the Constitution of such aforementioned practices which I'm sure can be and should be eliminated by Federal Law & ue of Military Force in this Country in the South/Southeast South west In fact all over this country.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: It is my utmost desire that conditions bearing on religion, creed and particular race will be alleviated more than it is now. It is a known fact that ignorance is the cheif cause of the  preseasstion  -here- But candidly I believe that the federal government will have to take a more rigorous stand than it has taken to help stamp out the  menance  that might some day reduce our great country into a second or third rate one.

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I have a serious desire to see this country of ours become  of the Atlantic charter and giving more than lip utterances to our two most important documents the Declaration of Independence and the Constitution

document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
q85: I would like to know more definite information concerning the rights and privileges granted in the GI Bill of Rights.

q85: I think the Army is a hell of an organization when it makes not attempts to protect the lives of some of its men from the narrow, bigoted citizens, no not citizens but denizens of the south. document_type: A document that contains one question (Q.85)
